Andrea is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in knitted and beaded hand-crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of materials like yarn, wooden beads, and jade, carved with the image of Hunab Ku, the Maya lord creator.

Andrea has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story:

"When I was a little girl, I used to watch my mom and grandmother knit for my siblings and I think those memories have something to do with my taste for individuality in design. That's how I got into designing and crafting my own accessories. When I realized that people liked my designs, I decided to venture into the world of arts and crafts and share my creativity. My inspiration comes from nature, music, and spirituality, as well as my dream of one day having my own company where I can design apparel as well as accessories.

"Thank you for supporting my art through this microcredit. It's so important for me to know that people beyond my country's borders like what I do and believe in me. You encourage young artisans like me to believe in our dreams. Greetings!" 

Use the link below to view Andrea's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8972

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials like yarn, wooden beads, and jade, carved with the image of Hunab Ku, the Maya lord creator.

loans.name: Arlin Damaris

texts.es: La señora Arlin, habita en el Barrio San Juan de la Concepcion. tiene 31 años de edad, casada tiene dos niños, a diario trabaja mucho junto a su esposo para obtener mejores ingresos y que sus hijos puedan tener las mejores condiciones, su mayor dificultad es que muchas veces se le presentan diversos inconvenientes  para realizar sus sueños. su esposo labora como cadete en una Moto taxi y ella vende Pan que elaboran en su casa y tambien vende Ropa, zapatos, ella vende de todo. con este credito podra comprar Harina, Azucar, Moldes, Ropa, etc. Doña Arlin Agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Arlin lives in the town of San Juan de la Concepcion. She is 31 years old and married with two children. Every day, she works hard with her husband to generate a better income so that her children can have the best conditions. Her greatest difficulty is that many times various problems arise when pursuing her dreams. Her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver and she sells bread that is made at home. She also sells clothes and shoes; she sells everything. With this loan, she will be able to buy flour, sugar, bread pans, clothes, etc. Arlin is grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith appreciates Kiva for her previous loans that have improved her living standards through the profits generated.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase cereals such as maize, beans, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and sugar for her business.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as maize, beans, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
This loan will help Raisa launch her own hair extension retail business. 

Raisa recently graduated from college, double majoring in Finance and Economics. By age 24, she has already launched her first business, CokaLouise ME, LLC, a retail company for hair extensions. Raisa purchases the extensions from wholesale distributors, prepares and treats the hair to strengthen and improve the quality, and then sells the products to individual buyers and hair salons. Raisa sells her products both online and locally within her New York and New Jersey communities. 

The young entrepreneur is looking for a loan to help her get CokaLouise ME off the ground. This loan will help Raisa purchase marketing materials, inventory and equipment so she can fill her orders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, inventory and marketing materials.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 47 years old. He is married with six children; they all go to school. He has spent more than twenty years rice farming. With the loan, Valens wants to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. He would like to use the profits from the produce to help in providing food for the family. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Philly

texts.en:
Philly is a 38-year-old man who lives within the border towns separating Uganda and Tanzania. He has a family of four children who attend elementary school. He has a veterinary supply shop where he earns income for a living. He started the shop because there was demand and yet there were no qualified personnel, so he seized the opportunity from which he has gained a lot of profits, though he is challenged by the high cost of the drugs and his capital is small.

Philly hopes to use the loan advanced to him to increase his stock so as to tap both markets at the cross borders.  He has a future plan of becoming a leading supplier of vet drugs in the town, a dream he can realize with help from Kiva lenders. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for the support so far. He says his main challenge is too little capital and long droughts that cause hoof and mouth disease, along  with low sales  during the dry spells.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata Binta's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, each of these teachers will be able to meet a certain financial challenge or challenges that if left with his/her salary alone, he/she will have not been able to meet. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Bontta, the 60-year-old is a widow with seven children, two of whom are still attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Fatmata has been a professional teacher for 29 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for her children.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in a rented house with his wife and three children. He is 35 years old. He works very hard to support his family through his Zoona mobile money transfer business.

John started running his Zoona mobile money transfer business in 2012. He started the business with working capital of  $1000. By saving and reinvesting his earnings he has grown his working capital to $2000 and is very happy with the growth. John says he loves his business because it is a way for him to provide for his family and at the same time provide a good service to his community. He explains that the people in his community of Chipata compound benefit from his business because they do not have to spend money traveling to other parts of Lusaka to access mobile money transfer services.

John has requested a Kiva loan so he can grow his business by increasing his working capital so he can serve more customers who are sending or receiving money at his shop and increase his earnings.

John dreams of opening up another mobile money transfer shop very soon. He is grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital and serving more customers

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
This loan will help Vanessa expand her janitorial and emergency restoration business that is focused on using sustainable and green products. 

Vanessa grew up in Colombia watching her parents struggle for financial security. After moving to Florida 10 years ago, Vanessa decided to follow in her parents’ footsteps by working in the cleaning industry, but she decided to do so in a new way: by being her own boss. In 2007, Vanessa opened her own company, Iza Environment Corp., a business specializing in commercial janitorial cleaning and sanitizing services as well as disaster restoration. Living in Florida where flooding, rain, and hurricanes affect businesses each year, Vanessa realized the need to offer reliable and immediate emergency response cleanup services to her local community. She has a crew of 42 employees and has contracts for local office buildings, distribution plants, airports and military bases. 

Her business is growing quickly and she is now looking for a loan to purchase additional cleaning equipment and supplies to keep up with the high demand for her company’s services. 

To view more about Vanessa’s business, visit: http://www.izaenvironment.com/

loans.use: to purchase janitorial equipment and inventory.

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en:
Agnes' Group is composed of ten persons who are friends, all living in the same neighborhood in Ghana. The group's representative, Agnes, is 43 years old and married to a man named Jonas. The couple have two children, and both are still in their care. Both of the children are in school. 

Agnes dropped out of primary school. For ten years, she has been selling smoked fish which she buys at the fishing port and she smokes the fish outside of her home. This enables her, along with her husband, to ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. 

This is the sixth time that Agnes and the other members of the group are requesting a loan from ID-Ghana. This total loan amount of GHS 5450 will enable them to bolster their businesses and to increase their working capital in order to respond to the demand of their customers. They are involved in the sale of metal utensils, fish, rice, dippers and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy fish from the port and sell it to customers

loans.name: Djèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques les sept  femmes du groupe Djèkafo ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du beurre de karité, des condiments (boites de tomate concentrées, tablettes de cubes Maggie,  d’oignon, pâtes alimentaires, ..), du savon et des chaussures d’enfants. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Tenincoura (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse dans la vente du beurre de karité de qualité; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200kg de beurre de karité. Elle se ravitaille en gros à Bougouni. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Tenincoura espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The Djèkafo Group is made up of seven married women living mainly in polygamous households. They have an average age of 48 years and an average of five children. They all live in the neighborhood of Sabalibougou in the district of Bamako. They know one another through ties of vicinity, and through their businesses in the Sabalibougou market. The members of this group are merchants with small businesses selling shea butter, vegetable sauces (made up of canned tomato concentrate, Maggie bouillon cubes, onions, and pasta), soap, and children's shoes. In order to increase their business capital, the group has decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their first group loan cycle.

Tenincoura (shown in the photo standing on the far left) sells high quality shea butter. She plans to use this loan to buy 200 kg of shea butter. She purchases it wholesale in Bougouni. She then resells her merchandise for cash and on credit in Sabalibougou and by traveling to her clientele, which is composed mainly of women.

With this loan, Tenincoura hopes to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 Francs CFA. She plans to use her income to reinvest in her business and to ensure the good health of the children in her household.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale shea butter for resale.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles de cuisine, fruits, légumes, poulets rôtis et des condiments (pâte alimentaire, oignon précuit et de la farine de piment). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande restauratrice à Sabalibougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 poulets au marché.  Les poulets sont rôtis et revendus au comptant ou à crédit à la porte de leur maison à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en produits de première nécessité. Madame Mariam ambitionne d’acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djiguiya group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 37 years old, with three children. They all live in the Sabalibougou neighborhood in the Bamako district and know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their work as vendors at the Sabalibougou market. The group members sell kitchen utensils, fruits, vegetables, roasted chicken and condiments (pasta, cooked onion and ground pimento). In the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Mrs. Mariam (the one seated in the middle of the photo) is well known for her cooked food in Sabaibougou. She plans to sue her loan to buy 35 chickens at the market. She roasts the chickens and sells them for cash and on credit in front of her house to a customer base composed mainly of men. With this loan, Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide first necessity items for her household. Mariam’s goal is to be able to buy a plot of land to use for housing thanks to her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Gloria Ester

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Anteriormente se dedicaba a vender ropa y hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida como ser baleada, tacos de pollo, pastelitos rellenos con carne de res, etc. el negocio lo tiene en un local alquilado al lado de su casa.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para comprar ollas y platos desechables para vender la comida. Este préstamo le ayudara a  aumentar las ventas ya que por los momentos no cuentan con suficientes utensilios  para elaborar la comida. Su meta es ampliar el negocio con el tiempo ya que el local es muy pequeño.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old, has two children, and lives with her husband in the town of San Pedro Sula. Previously she made her living selling clothes, and for 5 years she has been selling food, such as baleadas [flour tortillas filled with mashed fried beans], chicken tacos, pastries filled with beef, etc. She has her business in a rented space next to her house. 
The loan that she has requested is for 5,000 lempiras, and she will use it to buy pots and disposable plates to sell her food. This loan will help her to increase her sales, since sometimes she does not have enough utensils to make the food. Her goal is to grow the business over time, since her business retail space is very small.

loans.use: to buy pots to make food and disposable plates to sell the food.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.en:
This loan will help Gildardo expand his furniture store.

When Gildardo moved from Colombia to Massachusetts, he noticed the unfilled niche for a quality furniture store in Everett, MA, a suburb of Boston. Capitalizing on this idea, Gildardo began his own business, Everett Furniture Discount, in 2010. His store quickly gained popularity, and by 2012, Gildardo had already begun renting the space next door for a larger showroom. In order to keep up with the high demand, Gildardo needs a loan to purchase additional inventory in order to carry a larger selection of products for his customers. He hopes soon  to open a second location.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his furniture store.

loans.name: Ann Marie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 18,700,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf. 

Ann Marie is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Myamba town, the 52-year-old is married to a teacher and the couple has three children, one of whom is in college. Ann Marie has been a professional teacher for 31 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child

loans.name: Vandi Sanda's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org bases in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 8,500,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf. 

Vandi is the featured leader of this team of teachers. Vandi is a native of Kailahun town. He is married to a housewife and together they have three children. Vandi is a school teacher and has been in this profession for 32 years now. Vandi has requested this loan to buy a motorbike in order to facilitate his movements within and outside of the city.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike in order to facilitate his movements within and outside of the city

loans.name: Dennis M.k.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a total loan of SLL 17,900,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school's bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Dennis is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Massam, in southern Sierra Leone, 55-year-old Dennis is married to a housewife and the couple has four children who are attending primary and tertiary academic institutions. Dennis has been in the teaching profession for 33 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Mary A.e.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. 

This group of teachers has come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 6,200,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mary A.E. is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in Moyamba town, the 52-year-old is married to a civil servant and the couple has three children who are attending secondary and tertiary academic institutions.  Marie has been a professional teacher for 14 years now. She has requested this loan in order to invest it in business. She will use it to buy local produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy local produce to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a second-time borrower of the institution, applying for UGX 1,600,000/= loan. He is 41 years old and married, with five children. He drives a taxi as his source of income and this has helped him to service the previous loan well and also to educate his children. 

With the previous loan, Hassan managed to put up a residential house that he would like to occupy and stop renting since this is his major challenge. He wants to purchase the remaining iron sheets and doors for the house, not forgetting labor for the builders. He will later live comfortably in modest accommodation and also stop renting.

Hassan has future plans of having his house completed and paying the loan well, so that next time he can obtain another loan to purchase a taxi for himself.

In the photo are the UGOFODE Microfinance Limited credit officer (right) and the client, at his yet-to-be-completed house.

loans.use: to buy doors and iron sheets for his house.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es: Claudia es originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos.  Empezó hace 4 años con el negocio de video juegos, motivada por su hijo menor quien le solicito que pusieran este negocio para que los demás niños de su sector jugaran y se divirtieran, estableció el negocio en su casa de habitación, el cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante y  hoy en día es rentable por el aumento de ingreso que ha obtenido. Poco a poco ha ido comprando televisores para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Tiene como otra fuente de ingresos la comercialización de bebidas para la salud y cosméticos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: un televisor y nintendo ya que necesita abastecer a sus clientes con el fin de generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a native of the city of León. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Four years ago, she started her video game business in her home; she was motivated by her youngest son who asked her to start this business so that other children in the area could play and have fun. Through hard work and sacrifice, the business is still running and is currently profitable due to an increase in income. 

Over time, Claudia has purchased more televisions to offer better service to her customers. She also earns money by selling health drinks and cosmetics. She is requesting this loan to purchase a television and Nintendo to offer her customers, with the goal of generating more income.

loans.use: to buy a television and Nintendo.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with seven children, of whom three go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her grand children.

She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from   MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil. 

Rose works in her shop six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. She generates additional income through tailoring. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build rental rooms. 

She resides in a rented house in which the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Heather

texts.en:
"I want to encourage women to feel beautiful from what they're wearing… It's truly a great source of pride. There is power in fashion," says Heather, owner and founder of Heather Who.

Heather is a young woman trying to create a more fulfilling life for herself by doing what she loves. As a little girl growing up, Heather remembers sitting on the couch with her mother every night watching movies starring lead female roles like Hepburn and Monroe. Inspired by these women, Heather set out to discover what made these women so strong.

Shortly after graduating college, Heather realized that she would never be satisfied working for other people so instead she followed her entrepreneurial spirit and decided to do what she loves in order to make a living. Starting off by just word of mouth, Heather was able to create some buzz and pull in clientele for her brand new custom clothing businesses. Rather than opening a retail store, Heather knew that she wanted to make customized clothes so that her customers could see their outfits from start to finish. "It's a great experience when you know who made the clothes, and then there's truly a story with it," says Heather.

By starting this business Heather hopes to empower women through fashion in her community and with this loan of $10,000, Heather will be allowed to produce a small ready-to-wear collection for her online store as well as doing marketing.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to expand her line of products

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab is 53 years old. He is married and is the father of a son age 22. His wife works as a teacher of a primary school for a salary. 

Matlab has a technical high school education. He works as a truck driver for KAMAZ. In his vehicle, he carries sand and gravel. He has 23 years experience in this business and loves his job. 

Matlab is currently in need of a loan. His vehicle has technical problems. He wants to buy spare parts, repair his freight truck, and to continue his work. He is grateful for the support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, repair his freight truck, and to continue his work.

loans.name: Senelia Lisi

texts.es: Doña Senelia, tiene la edas de 27 años, casada tiene 2 hijos, desde muy Joven ella trabaja ya que su mayor sueño y meta es tener una familia y mejores condiciones de vida, su esposo labora como Obrero de la Construccion y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, pero no es suficiente para salir adelante, ella actualmente tiene su negocio vende Frutas, Verduras y Gallinas en la zona del Municipio de Ticuantepe, con esto ha logrado mantener su economia un poco estable, con este credito doña Senelia invertira en su negocio para asi obtener mayores ganancias, Agradece el apoyo a Afodenic y a Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Senelia, 27, is married and has 2 children. She's been working since she was very young because her biggest dream and goal was to have a family and improve her quality of life. Her husband works as a laborer in construction and he contributes to the household expenses, but it's not enough to get ahead. She runs a business selling fruits, vegetables and hens in the Ticuantepe municipality. With her business she has been able to stabilize her finances a little. Senelia is requesting a loan that she will invest in her business in order to increase her earnings. She is grateful for the support from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abie. She is married and has three children aged 13, 8, and 6 years. Two are schoolgoing children. In 2006, Abie established her food (groundnut, vegetable oil, and rice) business. She began her business because she was brought up by her elder sister who was a trader. Her sister prefers assistance with her trade instead of sending her younger sisters to school. Selling goods was the only skill she knew since her childhood. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 337,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. 

Abie requires a loan in order to purchase bags of groundnuts, vegetable oil, and bags of rice. In the future, Abie plans to improve her business. The loan will help her get more goods. Competition is her main challenge. She is honest and committed to her business.  She hopes to be funded so that she will improve her status. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts, vegetable oil, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 41 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado con Silveria y junto a ella tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juan se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano, arroz, yuca y otros. Su plantación principal esta conformada por diversas variedades de plátano las mismas que son de mayor demanda entre la población, sus productos son vendidos a los comerciantes mayoristas en los mercados de la ciudad. Lleva 20 años trabajando en este negocio y recuerda que al principio padeció mucho para establecerlo ya que necesitaba de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, antes sembraba papayas pero la llegada de la plaga echó a perder su inversión, sin embargo siguió adelante y pudo sembrar poco a poco otro cultivo. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones contratan los servicios de otros trabajadores. Afortunadamente le está yendo bien ya que la cosecha de sus productos se da con suma frecuencia ya que las diversas épocas de siembra en las que ha establecido las plantas le han servido para que tenga variación en la etapa de producción. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juan, 41, is a hard-working man married to Silveria. They live together in their own house with their 3 children. Juan works in agriculture, specifically in farming regional products, like plantain, rice, yuca and others. His main plantation comprises diverse varieties of plantain, those that are in high demand in his region. His products are sold to wholesale merchants in the city markets. He's been running his business for 20 years and remembers how much work and effort it took to establish it. He used to sow papaya, but a plague arrived and destroyed his investment. However, he soldiered on and began sowing a different crop. He works with the help of his wife and on some occasions he contracts the services of other workers. Fortunately, it's going well for him; his crops are harvested frequently because he established different sowing times and now he has variation in his production stage. On this occasion he is requesting 2,000 soles. He's very happy to know that he'll have financial support and as such feels secure that he can move his business forward. He promises to make punctual payments. With the loan requested, he will buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.use: buy organic manure.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is a 56-year-old, married man with five children. Rasim’s wife stays at home, taking care of their children. Rasim is self-employed and serves people with his own micro-bus. He works on special orders and with regular clients. His son wants to start a taxi service.

 Rasim's request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Vision Fund AzerCredit (VFAC), permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 1600 AZN will allow Rasim to help pay for buying the car. His son will transport passengers throughout the country. 

Rasim is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person, with a great desire to provide his children with a good education so they can progress in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Rasim is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To buy a car for his son's taxi service.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has five children, aged 25, 23, 20, 17 and 14. 

In 1982, Ibrahim established his electrical goods and jewelry business. He began his business just to enable him to solve his domestic problems. His business is located at city center and his main customers are both grown-up men and women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 21-inch televisions (SLL 1,000,000), musical sets (SLL 2,500,000) and jewelry (SLL 500,000). He hopes that this loan shall increase his capital base and, hence, increase his income. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his children and to travel to the holy land of Mecca for pilgrimage. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin was born in 1968. He has one kid who is nine years old.

He grew up in the region he lives in and the majority there earn a living working in agriculture or with livestock.  Elvin earns a living in agriculture, planting fruits and vegetables and raising cattle. 

He is seeking this loan in order to build a stable for animals. With this loan, he will be able to buy construction materials. His dream is for his business to grow. His business is the only source of income for him and his family.  He likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a stable for cattle

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is a 62-year-old, married woman, from Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items, like soft drinks, noodles, condiments, coffee, sugar, soaps, and biscuits. She has been running a variety store for more than ten years. 

To continue her livelihood activity, Naida requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more stocks, like canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks, and fishing materials, like fish net. 

In the future, Naida would like to expand her sari-sari store business to have a stable source of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, like canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks, and fishing materials like fish net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc., for her general store business. Jesselyn has been in this business for 3 years. Jesselyn earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Jesselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is a young dairy farmer living in a peri-urban zone with neighbors unhappy with the smells and flies emanating from his property. Furthermore, it's not financially viable for him to continue purchasing agrochemical fertilizers because he cannot justify the yields after considering the input cost.

By investing in his 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will eliminate the piled manure on his property, improving hygiene, reducing smells, and dramatically reducing the number of flies breeding on his farm. He will also shift from agrochemical fertilizer to biofertilizer for use on his animal fodder. This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Tsvakai

texts.en:
Tsvakai is a 33-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four. She lives in a village in the district of Buhera of Zimbabwe. Tsvakai has been operating a poultry business in her community since 2010, producing and selling about 125 broiler chickens per month.  She has one employee to assist her with the business.  

This business has enabled her to send three of her children to school as well as provide for five other dependents. With the requested loan, Tsvakai sees a good opportunity to expand her business by hiring additional employees and purchasing more chicks and chick feed. Her dream is to create more jobs to turn the tide of poverty in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and hire more employees

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Ireen is a 35-year-old single mother with a 14-year-old daughter. She lives in a fishing community on the shores of Lake Kariba in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe.  Since 2007, she has been running a business of buying and selling shoes, jewelry, shirts, skirts, and travelling bags. Ireen also serves as the leader of her local Cama chapter and volunteers as a Community Health Trainer providing basic health information to students and to other members of her community.

With the loan, she plans to purchase more shoes, jewelry, shirts, skirts, and travelling bags to increase her stock. She is hoping to expand her business and use the proceeds to enroll her daughter in a good school and manage to pay the school fees required.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing more clothes.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is a 26-year-old businesswoman. She is currently married with one child and lives in the Mbire District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery store for over a year and a half and employs one person to assist her.   When she is not working in her shop, Chipo serves as the Chairperson of her district’s Cama chapter and volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools within the community.

With the requested loan, Chipo intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool to reduce costs and boost her sales volume and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a large retail business, create even more employment in her community, and provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
Kerto Sato Group continues with loans for the sixth time. The loan period is still used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Two members of the group can’t attend the meeting because they have a religious ceremony at the temple. 

Ni Ketut uses the loan to buy three piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive -- IDR 500,000 per piglet. 

She and the members of Kerto Sato Group hope the loan in the next period can be increased, so that their businesses can flourish. Ni Ketut and all group members hope this effort will be advanced and that they could become independent in the attempt, so they don't need to borrow anymore.

loans.use: to buy three piglets.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Cristina tem 36 anos de idade, é casada e nao tem nenhum filho. Vive com sua irma que tem 2 filhos. Ela e Operaria Agricola numa empresa de producao de banana há mais de 2 anos.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra  de material de construcao (blocos, cimento, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old and married, and she doesn't have any children. She lives with her sister who has two children. She has been a farm worker for a banana company for over two years.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, a door) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, a door) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a single mother who lives in the community of Conacon, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte. For the past nine years she has run a general store in order to support her child and herself. Her determination to become successful makes her work hard.

Rosalinda joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed 5,000 PHP to buy extra groceries such as canned goods and noodles for her shop to augment her present inventory. She is happy that with this loan she can make more in profits and save a portion of it for the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy extra groceries for her shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old, and is married with one child. She currently lives in the district of Gokwe North in Zimbabwe where she runs her own stall at a flea market. She sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and tops. She has been operating the business for four years and has managed to support her family together with four other dependents.  Florence also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer and provides basic health information to students and to other members of her community.  

With the requested loan, Florence plans on increasing her stock which she hopes will increase her sales volume. The additional profits will help Florence cover the school fees for the four dependents whom she cares for in addition to her child.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing more clothes

loans.name: Etty

texts.en:
Etty is 26 years old and married. She is an aspiring businesswoman operating a small grocery shop in her village in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe.  For over a year and a half, she has successfully sold sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool.  

She is the former District Chairperson of the Cama network in her district and a Community Health Trainer who provides basic health information to students and to other members of her community. She actively motivates young women and girls to be self-reliant and to put education first before marriage. 

With the requested loan, Etty intends to purchase additional stock in bulk to reduce costs and increase her sales volume. She hopes to expand into a larger retail business so as to meet the needs of her family and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: Dudzai

texts.en:
Dudzai is a 28-year-old and lives in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating her own hair salon for two years. She offers services such as hair braiding and haircuts, but also sells hair products such as weaves, braids, hair oils, hair sprays, dyes, hair foods and hair pins.  Through her business, she has supported two young people who are dependent upon her.  As the leader of the Cama chapter in her district, she encourages other young women to strive to improve their quality of life.

The requested loan will enable her to increase her stock and expand her sales of hair products. Her desire is to aid in the development of the community through employment creation as well as to improve her own standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair products

loans.name: Letticia

texts.en:
Letticia is 35 years old and married. She lives in the district of Wedza in Zimbabwe. For two years she has been engaged in market gardening, providing a wide range and steady supply of fresh produce such as vegetables, tomatoes, carrots and onions throughout the local growing season. 
	
Letticia plans to use a loan to purchase a water pump, irrigation pipes and fertilizer to increase production on her land. Her hope is to expand the business and become a wholesale provider of fruits and vegetables.  This will enable her to not only provide for her family’s basic needs, but also to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: El Oro Group

texts.es:
Nolvia, tienen 30 años de edad, tiene cuatros hijos, esta casada y vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva  3 años de tener su propio cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ha decidido formar un grupo para solicitar el préstamo, el cual es por 11,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y limpieza de la finca de café, con el objetivo de obtener mejores cosechas y ganancias para poder en un futuro tener su propia casa.
El grupo se llama El Oro y esta integrado por 10 personas, quienes han solicitado un préstamo total de 97,000 Lempiras, para fertilizar, abonar y limpiar  la finca de café. Todos viven en la misma comunidad. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta José, seguido esta Sara, luego Juan, Alba blusa amarilla, María de blusa morada, Reyna, Nolvia a la derecha, en frente esta Nelson y doña María Victorina de blusa rosada y Blanca quien no pudo salir en al foto.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives in the Nueva Frontera municipality in Santa Barbara. She has always worked in agriculture. She has been growing her own coffee, corn, and bean crops for 3 years. This activity is her family's source of income.

She decided to form a group to request a loan for 11,000 lempiras. It will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and manure, and will also be used to clean the coffee fields, with the goal of improving her harvest and earning more money so that she can have her own home in the future.

The group is called El Oro and it is made up of 10 people who have requested a total of 97,000 lempiras in loans to fertilize, spread manure, and clean their coffee fields. They all live in the same community. In the photo, they are identified as follows: to the left is Jose, next is Sara, then Juan, Alba is wearing the yellow shirt, Maria is wearing the purple shirt, Reyna, Norma is to her right. Nelson is in the front, Maria Victorina is wearing the pink shirt, and Blanca could not be in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure, and to clean the coffee fields.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married and has two children, both of whom go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a pub business, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the funds to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of locally-made gin.

She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity, and she works from home, seven days out of every week. She sells beverages on both a retail and a wholesale basis.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to own a fully-stocked pub, and also to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of locally-made gin.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina, 41, is the wife of an overseas worker who lives in Silawe, Polanco, Zamnoanga Del Norte with her two siblings. While waiting for her husband to return, she is running a general store in their community and taking care of the rice paddies her husband bought from his salary. She has managed both through her determination to be successful.

Divina joined Gata Daku MPC recently and has applied for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes for an abundant harvest in order to use the profits on her business and for family expenses.

In the future Divina wants to see her children leading successful lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en: Rabina is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of five children. The oldest is 14 while the youngest is 7. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, and canned goods. She has been running a store for more than five years. Her husband is a fisherman. His meager income was not able to meet the family's daily needs, so Rabina requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy two sacks of rice, canned goods, and pollard (pig feed) to continue her livelihood activity and maintain the inventory of the stock in her store to attract more customers. In the future, Rabina would like to expand her sari-sari store business to be able to send all her children to a college education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, canned goods, and pollard (pig feed)

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
A Sra. Joana de 34 anos de idade, é solteira e tem uma filha que está a frequentar a escola no ensino secundário. Ela é empregada doméstica numa empresa de produção de banana.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção (chapas, barrotes, aros, janelas, blocos e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Joana is 34 years old and single, and she has a daughter who attends high school. She works as a maid for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, beams, window frames and bricks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, beams, window frames and bricks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Beverly works hard to support her family. She has a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She also earns money by buying and selling charcoal.

Beverly has successfully paid back nineteen previous loans obtained through NWTF. She is now applying for a new loan of 29,500 PHP to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, bread, etc. She hopes that her hard work will help her continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of sterling silver and natural gemstones, to use in producing jewelry.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I began learning to carve wood when I was in elementary school. My grandfather, an architect of traditional Balinese buildings and also a senior carver, was very supportive of me. Then my father introduced me to a leading silversmith in my village, and I began to learn from him."

"I feel very grateful for your timely microcredit, because it will allow me to prepare a good stock in time for the holiday season. Thank you so much for making this microcredit happen for me."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3703

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sterling silver and natural gemstones, to use in producing jewelry

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and married with two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store and does farming in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries and farm supplies for her rice field.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store and farming for three years, and she also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and farm supplies for her rice field

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 54-year-old woman, married to Daniel, 55, who works as a civil servant. They are blessed with three children, namely: Sefni, married, 33, Pastor; Johanes, 24, Mandarin lecturer; Christo, 13, junior high school student.

Victoria runs an ornamental plants business. She has been operating the business since 2009; she purchases the flower seeds from plant nurseries around the town, then grows and sells them to her customers to support her family’s needs. She started the business using her own capital (IDR 3,000,000). 

Victoria is hoping to improve her ornamental plants business, therefore she requests a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. The loan is for flower seeds, flower racks, flowerpots, and fertilizer, and also to purchase the material to build her house. She hopes that her business will run well, so she will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds, flower racks, flowerpots, and fertilizer, and also to purchase the material to build her house.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn's 13th loan cycle and she is very thankful for the financial assistance that she is receiving. She used her loan in her business which is a variety store. She is adding more products in her store as the demand continues to increase. She has a child who is studying and her income from business is helping to support her child's educational needs. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 15,000, for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Katlyn hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store someday and she dreams to give her child a good life and a future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 37 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in a peaceful village of the Bakan district of Pursat province, which is located in the western part of the country. To earn a living, she owns and helps her husband operate a rice farm as their major source of income. In years to come Ly aims to get ahead in her current business, saving and buying additional lots to gain more harvest, through her effort, sacrifice and perseverance.

She wants to improve the general living condition of the entire family--that’s why she has requested a loan to build a latrine in her home and buy its facilities. Through the loan, she will be able to make her family members more comfortable and increase the value of his house. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than the usual loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine in her home and buy its facilities.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.pt:
A Senhora  Ana é solteira, mãe de 3 filhos, que estão frequentando o nίvel primário e secundário. Tem 39 anos de idade, é docente há 16 anos e é estudante universitária. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos.
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar varões, cimento, areia e pedra para iniciar a construção de uma dependência para poder posteriormente arrendar e assim aumentar os seus rendimentos.
No futuro gostava de começar um negócio de criação de frangos, para melhor poder sustentar os seus filhos, nomeadamente custear os estudos da filha que no próximo ano vai frequentar o nível superior.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has three children who attend primary and high school. She's 39 years old and has been a teacher for 16 years. She's also a college student. She lives with her children in a house that she owns.
With the money from the loan she'll purchase rods, cement, sand and rocks so she can start building a room. Later on she'll be able to rent out the room and therefore increase her earnings.
In the future she'd like to start a chicken raising business in order to better support her children, namely to afford her daughter's education since she'll be attending college next year.

loans.use: to purchase rods, cement, sand and rocks so she can start building a room.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 20 while the youngest is 8. She runs a sari-sari store. She sells various items like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, eggs, and soap. Her husband is a fisherman. His income was not able to meet the family's daily needs so Sonia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more stocks like condiments, beverages, and toiletries to maintain her stock and attract more customers, thus generating higher earnings. In the future, Sonia hopes that she will be successful in running her business and can continue to send all her children to school and provide them with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like condiments, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 42-year-old widowed woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store. She sells various items such as fabric conditioner, soaps, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, chips, and noodles. She has been running a sari-sari store for more than three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods to maintain the store inventory and attract more customers. In the future, Virginia would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, vitamins and feed for her chicken raising business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with five children. They all live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Betty operates a food stall, and she sells maize, beans, and vegetables in her stall. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase maize, fruits, vegetables, and beans for her business.

She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase maize, fruits, vegetables, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.pt:
Roda tem 42 anos de idade, é casada, tem 5 filhos e vive em casa dos pais.
Ela tem um negócio de venda de produtos alimentares que abastece aos seus clientes assalariados que só fazem pagamentos no  final do mês, por isso o dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de de produtos alimentares como frangos, palone e óleo de cozinha para revenda.
O seu sonho é expandir o seu negocio e fazer um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa.
texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and married. She has five children and lives in her parents' house.
She owns a business selling foodstuffs which she sells to her employed customers who only pay at the end of the month. For that reason the money from the loan will be used to purchase foodstuffs such as chicken, bologna and cooking oil for re-selling.
Her dream is to expand her business and build a store in her house.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs (chicken, bologna and cooking oil) for re-selling.

loans.name: Sarantuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarantuul, 38 years old, lives with her two sons in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been working in Korea on and employment contract for a long time. Her younger son has a disability and he needs constant care. Sarantuul began selling clothes to local people by renting a stall at a trade center in autumn, 2012. 

The house the family lives in has been deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, Sarantuul, together with her elder son, will repair and insulate their house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and emit less smoke into the atmosphere. 

According to a national research department, almost all the air pollution results from extensive burning of coal, so that measurements to reduce coal usage are taking place around the city by encouraging people to insulate their houses with high quality materials.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for her house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, who are in school, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her jeepney transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her businesses.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a motorcycle driver from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the motorcycle transport business for more than a year now. He is also engaged in the hog-raising business. 

Michael is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy feed for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his earnings from this motorcycle business as well as in his hog-raising venture. In the future, Michael hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of his income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Amanecer De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Duo Solidario Amanecer de San Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Hortensia, ella tiene 49 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo de tipo ambulante en su municipio de San Bartolomé, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su nueva campaña de pedido de cosméticos y su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio  y mantener siempre capital para invertir y ofrecer siempre los productos a sus clientes,agradese a Kiva y fape por la ayuda brindada y espera que le sigan apollando con su negocio ya que a sido de mucha bendicion su apoyo, tando para ella en su negocio como para su familia.
texts.en:
The Duo Solidario Amanecer de San Bartolo includes Hortensia. She is 49 years old and works selling catalog products door-to-door in her town, San Bartolomé. She is seeking a loan to use in placing a new round of cosmetic orders. Her greatest desire is to keep investing in her business and to always maintain capital so that she can purchase and offer products to her customers. 

She is grateful to Kiva and to FAPE for the help they have given, and she hopes that they will continue to support her in her work. Their help has been a great blessing, not only for her but also for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
This is Gilda, 50, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ermalito, a seaman, and a mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Gilda maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gilda hopes to have more items and dreams to gave a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Saturnina es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Líderes De Santa Rosa” grupo responsable conformada por 15 socios activos y emprendedores, que cada día buscan mejorar. Este es el caso de Saturnina de 54 años separada con 04 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Saturnina lleva más de 10 años con el negocio de alquiler de  cabinas de internet. Comenzó a trabajar con 03 máquinas con mucho esfuerzo pudo implementar su negocio, pues en la actualidad cuenta con 12 máquinas. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito, ya que implementará comprando audífonos, mouse y para el  mantenimiento de sus computadoras.  Comprar más computadores es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Líderes De Santa Rosa” está agradecido y comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Saturnina se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca negra y pantalón azul.
texts.en: Saturnina is a member of the Líderes De Santa Rosa communal bank, made up of 15 active and enterprising members who search for self-improvement every day.  This is the case of Saturnina.  She is 54 years old, separated, and has four children, one of whom is still dependent on her.  Saturnina has had an Internet café for more than 10 years.  She began her business with three machines and was able to grow it with some effort.  Now she has 12 machines.  She is asking for a loan so she can continue growing her business and buy headphones and mice to maintain her computers.  Buying new computers is her greatest desire.  The Líderes De Santa Rosa group is very grateful and promise to continue working well.  Saturnina is seated in the first on the right, wearing a black top and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario La Alameda De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Duo Solidario la alameda de Sumpango, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Paula de 38 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, ya que este negocio le a ayudado en gran manera economicamente a su familia, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos, esperando que Kiva le de la oportunidad de obtener el credito para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: The “Duo Solidario la alameda de Sumpango” includes 38 year old Maria Paula, who has been making and selling typical weavings for 10 years.  This business has helped her family financially and she is asking for this loan to buy supplies to make her typical weavings.  She hopes that Kiva will give her the opportunity of getting the loan so she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana pues es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividades económicas son: la venta de comida, frutas  y artefactos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, salchicha, papas y otros insumos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Evarista is 35 years old and is the single mother of two children.  She is a member of the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana communal bank and is a responsible, enterprising person who sells food, fruit, and artifacts.  She needs a loan to buy supplies such as chicken, sausages, potatoes, and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chicken, sausage, potatoes, and other items.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija (Ruth  de 3 años de edad). Maribel pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y a la venta de comida y mates. Ella viaja  a la comunidad de Jajahuana para las reuniones del banco comunal desde la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. Su sueño de Maribel es comprarse un carro.
texts.en: Maribel is 21 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one daughter (3 year old Ruth).  Maribel is a member of the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana communal bank because she is a responsible and enterprising woman.  She is a farmer, raises livestock, sells food, and teas.  She travels to Jajahuana, all the way from Cusco, for her communal bank meetings.  She needs this loan to buy livestock.  Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Cesar Ivan

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, es padre de 2 pequeños de 6 y 3 años a quienes quiere mucho, el trabaja cada día muy duro para poder salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como albañil en una pequeña empresa construcción, con cuyos ingresos solventa los gastos de su hogar con muchos esfuerzo.

Cesar esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindando el podrá comprar una refrigeradora, ya que actualmente no tienen una y siempre tiene problemas para conservar los alimentos. De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y darle una buena educación a sus hijos “.
texts.en:
Cesar is 26 years old and lives in the city of Pisco.  He is the father of 2 children, ages 6 and 3, whom he loves very much.  He works hard every day to get ahead.  He works as a mason for a small construction company and pays the household expenses with his earnings.

Cesar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to their help he will be able to buy a refrigerator, since they don’t have one and there are problems preserving food.  In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and he will continue to work to make his greatest dream come true, “Having a business of his own and providing his children with a good education.”

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y en una joven muy trabajadora, tal es así que trabaja como obrera agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad y con los ingresos que le brinda su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, Mery trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y porque quiere ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Mery esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder hacer una jaulas para conejo, ya que ella a iniciado su pequeño negocio de venta de estos animales, de esta manera podrá mejorar su pequeño negocio y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de administración y ser una gran profesional”
texts.en:
Mery is 20 years old and lives in the city of Imperial.  She is a hardworking young woman who works as a farm worker in town and uses her earnings to support her parents with the household expenses.  Mery works about 9 hours a day and she believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and because she wants to be her parents’ pride.

Mery is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are giving and thanks to them she can buy building materials so she can make rabbit cages, since she started a small business selling these animals.  In this way she can improve her income and continue to work toward making her dreams come true, “Studying for a management career and becoming a great professional.”

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Hitoshi

texts.en:
This loan will help Hitoshi grow his carpet and upholstery cleaning business.

While Hitoshi has moved many times in his life—from the Dominican Republic to Puerto Rico to Florida, his dream has remained the same: to open his own business and gain financial independence.  

In 2011, this dream became a reality when he opened Deep Cleaning Services, LLC, a company that provides carpet, upholstery and fabric cleaning services to both commercial and residential properties. Now with two employees, Hitoshi has expanded his business to also offer water damage restoration and applied structural drying.

Responsible for supporting his wife and three children, as well as his mother still living in Puerto Rico, Hitoshi is looking to expand his business. This loan will allow Hitoshi to purchase cleaning equipment and materials in order to accept more customers.

loans.use: to purchase necessary cleaning equipment and materials.

loans.name: Roxana Leticia

texts.es: Roxana, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo en el municipio de san Pedro Sula. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila, pero hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de palomillas de maíz envasada en bolsas y en ristras al igual que caramelos con sorpresas para los niños. Ella sale a vender su producto a varios lugares con el fin de obtener ingresos a diario. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de insumos como maíz, aceite, bolsas, caramelos y sorpresas (juguetes) para prepararlos en ristras y vender. Su plan es aumentar las ventas y las ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana is 22 years old. She has one son and lives with her husband in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. 

She previously worked in an assembly line, but for two years she has sold popcorn packed in bags and on strings, as well as candies with surprises for children. She goes out to sell the products to various places in order to obtain income on a daily basis.

The loan she has requested is for 10,000 Lempiras. She will use it to purchase inputs such as corn, oil, bags, candies and surprises (toys) to prepare on strings and sell. Her plan is to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as corn, oil, bags, candies and surprises (toys) to prepare on strings and sell.

loans.name: Hector Rolando

texts.es: Don Héctor, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Roatán. Don Héctor se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de motorista de un bus de ruta en la comunidad. Hace 3 años y medio inicio un negocio de una pulpería en la cual vende granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, lácteos, productos enlatados, jabón, azúcar, manteca,  etc. Ha mantenido estable su negocio mediante la inversión de tres préstamos anteriores, actualmente ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo que es por 17,000 Lempiras y lo va a utilizar en la compra de productos para surtir el negocio. Comprara granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, refrescos y otros que necesite. Su plan es ser un micro empresario y que la familia siempre tenga el negocio pensando en  llegar a ser un mini súper o más.
texts.en:
Don Héctor is 55, married, and the father of four children. He lives in the town of Roatán, where he worked as a bus driver. Three years ago, Don Héctor opened a small shop where he sells staple grains, meat, soft drinks, dairy products, canned goods, soap, sugar, butter, and other groceries. 

Three previous loans have allowed Don Héctor to keep his business stable, and he's now applied for a fourth loan. He will use the loan funds, 17,000 Lempiras, to purchase goods to stock his store: staple grains, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, and other essential items. 

Don Héctor plans to be a small businessman and make his store into something his family will always be able to rely on. He hopes the store can eventually be a mini-market or even a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, and other goods he needs to supply his business.

loans.name: Ana
