texts.es: Ana, trabaja como asistente de hogar en una casa particular, devenga el salario mínimo, con los que mantiene los gastos de su casa;  siempre preocupada por el bienestar de sus dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 14 años, su mayor deseo es que  estudien una carrera profesional para su desarrollo personal.  Ana solicita el crédito para compra de materiales de construcción ya que  tiene proyectado hacer el muro perimetral sur de su vivienda, para ella es muy importante esta obra ya que le brinda protección y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana works as a domestic assistant in a private home. She earns minimum wage, with which she pays for her household expenses. Always concerned for the well-being of her two children, aged 7 and 14, her greatest wish is that they study to become professionals for their own personal growth.

Ana is seeking a loan to buy construction materials because she would like to build the southern perimeter wall of her home. For her, this project is very important because it offers protection and security to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, cinder blocks, and quarried stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to service commercial businesses and to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, canned goods, wood, charcoal and other goods

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 29, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Carol, a housewife, and they have two children. Together they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Romeo operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials, like metal, copper, plastic, and paper. They sell these to junk shops like Romeo's, for a little profit. Junk shops then sort, clean, stack, and gather huge quantities of these materials, and sell them back to factories and other buyers. Romeo regularly buys recyclables from his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his revolving fund, which he uses to buy trash from collectors.

Romeo dreams to expand his business and have another junk shop. He hopes to have good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials from the collectors

loans.name: Eli Santos

texts.es: Doña Eli, tiene 48 años, es madre soltera y tiene 9 hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de artículos desechables de plástico, chatarra como artículos de hierro, aluminio, cobre y otros materiales. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos. Ha manejado tres préstamos en ODEF para comprar y vender materiales de reciclaje. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar el cuarto préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras. Con el cual va comprar artículos en mal estado que tengan hierro, aluminio, cobre y otros para vender. Su objetivo es lograr comprar un vehículo para movilizarse a comprar chatarra y vender más.
texts.en: Eli, 48, is a single mother of 9 children with whom she lives in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon. She has always dedicated herself to commerce. She's been running her recycling business for 15 years, selling disposable plastic and scrap metal, like iron, aluminum, copper and other materials. This business is her source of income. She has had 3 loans from ODEF to buy and sell recyclable items. Currently she is requesting a loan of 12,000 Lempiras; this is her fourth loan. With this loan she will buy items that are in bad shape that contain iron, aluminum, copper and other metals that she can sell. Her objective is to buy a vehicle so she can move around buying scrap metal and selling more.

loans.use: buy items that are in bad shape that contain iron, aluminum, copper and other metals that she can sell.

loans.name: Rio Nilo Andre

texts.es:
Rio Nilo es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rio Nilo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea.
por iniciativa propia, trabaja como empleado en una empresa funeraria de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rio Nilo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una cocina para su hogar, la cual reemplaza a su cocina de kerosene que su uso es peligroso, de esta manera Rio Nilo desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Rio Nilo is a 22 year old man, single, and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, because of the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Rio Nilo has not been able to study as he would have liked to for a Business Administration career.

Through his own initiative he works as an employee for a funeral home in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes he is doing well because of his good performance and the friendly treatment he gives to others.

Rio Nilo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help he can buy a kitchen stove for his home which replaces the kerosene stove which is dangerous to use. Rio Nilo wants to offer better security and wellbeing to his family in this way, as well as continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen stove to replace a kerosene stove which is dangerous to use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle and to install the doors.

loans.name: Herliyanti

texts.en:
Herliyanti is a 35-year-old woman who is married to Marthinus, a 38-year-old man. Her husband is an entrepreneur. They have two children, namely: Gerardo, 4, in kindergarten, and one-year-old Geraldine. 

She started her kiosk business in 2011 using her own capital (IDR 2,500,000). She wants to improve her business by adding more ‘daily basis’ needs to her inventory, but due to the lack of capital to do so, she requests an individual loan from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. 

The loan is to buy more instant noodles, rice, flours, sugar, milk, eggs, soaps, tea, soft drinks and prepaid mobile phone cards. She hopes that the business will run well so she will be able to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of instant noodles, rice, flours, sugar, milk, eggs, soaps, tea, soft drinks and mobile phone pulses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel his work space

loans.name: Yurica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yurica tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 2 pequeños de 3 y 4 años a quienes quiere mucho y trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante; es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo ella trabaja, estudia y es madre a la vez. Yurica estudia la carrera de arquitectura y para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como docente en una universidad de su ciudad.

Yurica está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá construir habitaciones para sus hijos, con lo cual podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” darle una profesión  sus hijos y poder terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Yurica, age 29, has two little ones, ages three and four.  She loves them a lot, and she works very hard in order to get them ahead.  That is why she works with great effort, studies, and is a mother at the same time.

Yurica is studying architecture.  In order to pay for her studies, she works as a teacher at a university in her city.

Yurica is very grateful for the support provided to her by the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided her, she will be able to build rooms for her children.  By doing so, she will be able to improve their quality of life.  This way she will continue working in order to be able to make her biggest dream a reality.  Her dream is to give her children a profession and to be able to finish building her house.

loans.use: to build rooms.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Don Eleuterio es originario del municipio de El Sauce, nació y fue criado en el caserío de la montañita pero desde hace 23 años habita en la parte urbana desde que se casó y formó su familia.
Actualmente tiene cuatro hijos todos están estudiando y su mayor deseo es ver preparados profesionalmente a todos, por eso hace cada el mayor esfuerzo en trabajo para darle lo mejor a su familia.
A pesar de tener un trabajo arriesgado como conductor de ambulancia se siente muy satisfecho porque ayuda a salvar muchas vidas trasladándolas de un lugar a otro.
En este momento don Eleuterio tiene la necesidad de un crédito para compra de medicamentos, realización de placas y ultrasonidos, ya que últimamente ha presentado problemas en su columna debido a largas horas de viajes.
Pide a los inversionistas de Kiva que apoyen su solicitud para poder mejorar su salud, ya que con su salario solamente alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eleuterio originates from the municipality of El Sauce. He was raised in the settlement of La Montañita, but he's been living in the urban area for 23 years since he got married and started a family. 
Currently, they have 4 children who are in school. His greatest wish is to see them all become professionals, which is why he works so hard to provide the best for his family. 
Despite having a risky job as an ambulance driver, he finds it very satisfying to help save lives by transporting people from one place to another. 
At this moment, Eleuterio is requesting a loan to buy himself medicines and pay for x-rays and ultrasounds, as he's currently presenting with back problems from the long hours of driving. He is asking the Kiva investors to support his request so he can improve his health, as his salary only affords him the household expenses.

loans.use: buy himself medicines and pay for x-rays and ultrasounds.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Antonio habita en El sauce desde que nació, tiene la edad de 51 años y a los 20 años inició a trabajar como inspector de enfermedades para el centro de salud de la localidad al mismo tiempo formó su familia donde hoy en la actualidad tiene tres hijos dos de ellos estudiando la primaria y secundaria.
Don Pedro tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel, créditos que le han ayudado a su desarrollo personal porque están en el tiempo que más los necesita para resolver sus problemas personales.
Actualmente don Pedro está solicitando un crédito para compra de medicina y pago de realización de cirugía de su esposa, ya que se vió mal con el embarazo por lo que la tuvieron que intervenir quirúrgicamente.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel financien su solicitud, agradece por todo este tiempo que le han apoyado.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio has lived in El Sauce since he was born. He is 51 years old, and he started working when he was 20 years old as an inspector of diseases for a city health center, working and bringing up his family and now today he has three children, two of them students in primary and secondary schools.

Pedro has gotten loans through Ceprodel for many years, loans that have helped his personal growth because they are time sensitive resolving his personal problems when most needed.

Currently Pedro is asking for a loan in order to buy medicine and pay for surgery for his wife, as things looked bad with her pregnancy and so they had to intervene surgically.

He hopes and trusts in God that Kiva lenders through Ceprodel finances his loan, and he is grateful for those who have helped him all this time.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for his wife's surgery.

loans.name: Cielito

texts.en:
Cielito is 52 years old, married with three children. She offers a variety of merchandise within her village. She has been in this kind of business for three years. 

Cielito would like to request PHP 14,000 in additional capital. This amount will be used to buy merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles, shampoo and detergent. 

She knows that through her dedication and patience she could further improve her variety store. In addition, through the loan, she could also earn greater profits that will help with her family's daily consumption, the education of her children and to obtain a better way of living. Cielito would be thankful if her requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles, shampoo and detergent

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a married man and a father of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. He has run a hog raising business for more than 6 years now. This is his only source of income.
Marcos is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his hog raising business thus augmenting his income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is 44 years old and married to a farmer. They are blessed with six children. She has been raising hogs for 10 years now. According to her, she needs to double her efforts to sustain the needs of her family, especially the needs of her children in school. Lyn hopes that her business will expand so that she can improve the living standard of her family. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she will earn more income.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her hog raising business

loans.name: Kimcheang's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Kimcheang is a 54-year-old mother of eight children. To support her family, she and her husband have been working as paid workers. Having been in this job for 10 years, she is able to earn about 31,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s need. 
This is Kimcheang's first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising in order to earn extra income for her family. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising in order to earn extra income

loans.name: Sainkhishig

texts.en:
Mrs. Sainkhishig, 46 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter studies at medical college in Darkhan and is currently on summer vacation. Her son lives separately from her and got married. She hasn't divorced her husband officially, but they live separately. 

She has been running a furniture making workshop for thirteen years and employs two people. Last year, the house she lived in was burned down and only four walls remain. Now she and her daughter are residing in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). 

As winter is approaching Mongolia, she wants to build a new house on the remains of her old house. To do this, she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. 

Using those materials, she can make her old house more comfortable and better at retaining warmth. As a result, the house will no longer lose its heat and the family will burn less coal, thus releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a mat weaver from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. Wilma has been in the mat-weaving business for more than five years. This is the source of her income.

Wilma is asking for a loan to buy more materials for making mats, for example nipa, romblon, straw, and dyes. With these materials, she will be able to make more mats and sell them to the market. In the future, Wilma hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making mats, for example nipa, romblon, straw, and dyes

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
This is Gilbert who is 29.  He is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rowena and they have children.  At this time, he is working hard to meet his family's needs. 

Gilbert is a coconut vendor. Most Coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing wooden deep carts. The coconuts are served with one end cut and a straw in it to serve as the container itself or also, coconuts can be offered where the juice and flesh are served in a plastic bag with a straw. His regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. He earns a minimum of PHP 850 per day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy tires for his cart, wood, coconuts, nails, paint, and a cooling container. 

Gilbert dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes to have a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.*

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To assist him with his coconut vending business

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es:
Gilberto vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, tiene 40 años de edad, y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos.  Gilberto es un hombre muy trabajador, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su negocio de venta de ropa ya que con los ingresos de este negocio puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo.

Gilberto esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como polos, chompas, entre otros, así el tendrá mayor variedad de productos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives in the city of Huaraz. He is 40 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 children. Gilberto is a hardworking man which is why he puts a lot of effort into his business every day selling clothing as the earnings from this business pay for the household expenses through his struggles.

Gilberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided he can buy more merchandise for his business such as polo shirts, sweaters, and more, so he can have a better variety of products and continue fighting in order to achieve his greatest dream: “Providing for his children to become professionals.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Khonh's Group

texts.en:
Khonh is aged 50 years old and married. She is a mother of two children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 15 years.
This is Khonh's first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, Khonh is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme DELPHINE est la représentante du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE.   DELPHINE est  mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 02mois. 03 vont à l’école. 
Elle prépare et vend le dolo  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Bendatoega. Ses clients sont les femmes et les  hommes.
Elle veut  s’acheter  03sacs de sorgho rouge et 04 charrettes de bois pour la préparation de son dolo.
Mme veut réinvestir  ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et aider à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine is the representative of the "Saint Jean Baptiste" group. Delphine is married and is the mother of five children ranging in age from two months to 13 years. Three of her children go to school.

For the past eight years, she has been making and selling "dolo" (millet beer). She buys her supplies at the Bendatoega market. Her clients are both men and women. She would like to buy three sacks of red sorghum and four cartloads of wood to make her dolo.

She would like to reinvest her profits. She would like to grow her business and help with her children's schooling.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of sorghum and 4 cartloads of wood to make "dolo," a local beverage.

loans.name: Benita Lissette

texts.es: Doña Benita es originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño de 5 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 8 años, en este negocio la apoya su mama quien comenzó esta actividad lo cual ha sido rentable. Primeramente ofrecían dos tipos de comidas debido a la demanda de sus clientes ahora poseen seis tipos de comida lo cual es de satisfacción para el cliente. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne, verduras y utensilios de cocina con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio. Este crédito le ayudara a tener mayores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benita, 31, is from the city of León.  She's married and the mother of one child, age 5.

Benita has made a living selling food for eight years and it has been profitable.  Her mother, who started this business, helps her.  First they offered two types of food but because of customer demand now they have six, and the customers are satisfied.

She's requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, vegetables, and kitchen utensils.

Her goal is to provide better service.  This loan will help her have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The needs of today's family life are very expensive. This forces everyone to work hard, to make ends meet. Dewa Ayu can not just rely on the income of her husband; she also has to work. Raising pigs is one solution for her.

Dewa Ayu got a part of this group loan, which she used to buy four piglets, at a price per piglet of 400,000 IDR, and to buy pig feed. Her husband and her two children help her to raise pigs. They and Dewa Ayu feed the pigs and clean their cage, every day. Because she takes care to maintain the cage and to feed the pigs with good hygiene, Dewa Ayu hopes her pigs will be healthy and thrive.

There are now three new members of Daya Pertiwi group, and three who were members at the time of the previous (8th) loan have left the group.

loans.use: To purchase four piglets and feed.

loans.name: Widi

texts.en:
Widi just began working with Ruma on 24 July 2013 to run Ruma’s new business, serving cash-in and cash-out customers’ money to Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent in Ruma, Widi needs and hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to start his new business. Widi wishes this new business to be the other source of his income.

Widi lives in Desa Lumbung Selemadeg Barat, Bali, a rural area about four hours from Denpasar. Widi is married, and he lives with six persons in his family’s house.

Prior to joining Ruma, Widi worked as a self-employee.

loans.use: to buy start-up credits to be able to process branchless banking products within the pilot period.

loans.name: Eric Jack

texts.es:
Erick tiene 27 años de edad, vive en Pucallpa, es padre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, al que quiere mucho. Erick y para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar trabaja como repartidor, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable y responsable.

Erick está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Erick is 27 years old and lives in Pucallpa. He has a five-year-old son that he loves very much. To pay for his household expenses, Erick works doing deliveries. He works around 10 hours per day and says that he is getting ahead because he is very kind and responsible.

Erick says he is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their enormous help, he will be able to do some improvements in his home. He says that this will improve his family’s quality of life, and that he will be able to continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality, which is to have his own house.

loans.use: to do some improvements in his home.

loans.name: Patron Santiago De Ccoc-Hua Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Patron Santiago de Ccoc-Hua”  en la comunidad de Ccoc – Hua  (La comunidad de Ccoc – Hua  está ubicado en el distrito de Curahuasi dentro de la provincia de Abancay del departamento del Apurimac). Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican al agricultura, artesanía, venta de comida, ganadería, crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Aniceta está levantando la mano en la fotografía, ella tiene 36 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y nació en la comunidad de Ccoc-Hua y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan y otras cosas más, ella también se dedica agricultura donde siembra habas y elabora chicha de jora, ella es una persona responsable y sus vecinos no dudaron en invitarle a participar del banco comunal. En esta oportunidad Aniceta requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche y otras cosas más. (En la parte inferior de la fotografia aparecen los socios que pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión)
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the communal bank “Patron Santiago de Ccoc-Hua”  in the community of Ccoc – Hua  (Ccoc – Hua is located in the  Curahuasi district of Abancay province, in the department of Apurimac).  This communal bank is comprised of people who are constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead.  With their daily efforts, the members of this group are providing a better future for their children.  These individuals work in agriculture, handicrafts, food sales, animal husbandry, and other occupations.

Aniceta is raising her hand in the photograph.  She is 36 years old and has 4 children.  She was born in the community of Ccoc-Hua, and this is where she has her business.  Aniceta sells staple consumer goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, bread, and other items.  She also works in agriculture, cultivating beans and making the beverage chicha de jora (a traditional, corn-based beverage).  She is a responsible person, and so her neighbors did not hesitate to invite her to join the communal bank.  At this time, Aniceta needs a loan to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk, and other products. 

(At the bottom of the photo, two members appear who asked permission to be absent from the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, cooking oil, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years. Hilario works hard to support the needs of the family, especially for the future schooling of his children. Hilario is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks. With this, he will be able to increase his daily catch which gives him more fish to sell in the market. Hilario dreams of making his fishing venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y, 48, is married and the mother of three adult children, one of whom is married and lives separately. She's a homemaker and a farmer helping her husband manage their own a few pieces of land for farming rice as it the sole source of income. Her challenge is unwanted weeds and pests which prevent her crops from growing freely, and reduce her productions. She has been doing farming business for more than 20 years.

Y wants to improve the general living condition of the entire family, so she needs a loan to build a bathroom, which can be used comfortably by her family members. This loan will increase the value of her house and also keep the surrounding environment clean and lessen disease. Her plans for the future are to have additional lots to cultivate and gain more outputs, and to transform from subsistence farming to a successful commercial agribusiness.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, which can be used comfortably by her family members.

loans.name: Tserenpil

texts.en: Tserenpil, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family income comes entirely from his transportation service which he has done for seven years consecutively. His two children both go to kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his house. As a result, his family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 31 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Gloria pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación Inicial.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gloria trabaja como maestra de educación inicial en un centro educativo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Gloria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá sus gastos de estudios para una especialización de docencia, de esta manera Gloria tendrá mejores posibilidades de ascender laboralmente, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 31-year-old single woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her parents. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who strives to get ahead in life. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Gloria was able to study Early Childcare Education. 
On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Gloria works as an early childcare teacher in an educational centre in her city. She works every day for approximately ten hours and she believes it is going well due to her good job performance and the kind way in which she treats others.
Gloria is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they are giving her, she will be able to cover the expenses involved in studying a teaching specialization. In this way Gloria will have a greater possibility of ascending the career ladder; she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to cover study expenses

loans.name: Lat's Group

texts.en:
As a resident from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Lat is a 31-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. The main source of family’s income is from rice farming, which she has been in for ten years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR70,000 per day to spend on daily expenses.

Lat is the first cycled client with VisionFund, and she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Lat will use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland.

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Saroen is 46 years old and married. She and her husband have six children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. 

Saroen and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working as a paid construction worker, as well as catching fish. They have been in this business for 20 years. With her current business, Saroen is able to earn approximately 20,000KHR per day to support her family. 

Saroen has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and she fully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 2,500,000KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on the boat to support her fishing business. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan is 44 years old. She has three children. Two daughters are learning in the 6th and 7th grade. A son is a carpenter. Her husband is a barber. He earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Lan cooks food to sell. She has done this job for ten years. Her income is 5,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, Lan also grows rice to earn more money. Her family’s total income is about 13,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges at work are having more competition, a considerable amount of debt buyers, and lacking of material facilities. Her dream is for her children to have successful lives and to expand her restaurant. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach her dreams. She can use this loan to invest in her business, to gain earnings, and save profit for her dream. Lan is a hardworking and careful woman. 
She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance  program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more ingredients to cook and buy more equipment to service her business.
Other members who are part of Lan’s group include the following: 
Phuong is 37 years old. She has two children. She sells food in a market. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy ingredients for making cake.
Huong is 42 years old. She has two children. She goes to the market to sell scrap. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to open a pawn service.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook and buy more equipment to service her business.

loans.name: Lahidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de vêtement de toutes sortes : pagnes wax, brodés, basins et d’habits de la friperie. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fati (femme debout seule sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes de meilleure qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 pièces de  bazin à Bamako et vend  au comptant et à crédit au marché  et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fati espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les soins de santé des enfants du foyer. Madame Fati ambitionne d’acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of four married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 31 years old, with five children. They all live in the Sabalibougou neighborhood in the Bamako district. They know each other as neighbors and fellow vendors at the Sabalibougou markets. The group members sell various types of clothing: traditional colorful fabric (wax “pagnes”, embroidered “pagnes,” and damask-type “bazins”) as well as second-hand clothing. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Fati (the only one standing in the photo) is well known as a vendor of high-quality traditional fabric. She plans to use her loan to buy four sets of the “bazin” type fabric in Bamako. She sells for cash or on credit, at the market and as a street vendor, to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Fati hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover the healthcare costs for her children. Her goal is to buy a land plot and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
With only eight members, the Kerta Jaya Amerta group continues its lending. The loans and the pig breeder program from MUK have proven to increase for their life. They can have a loan without collateral and also training for better knowledge of the pig business.

Ni Nengah is using her loans to purchase two superior piglets for fattening and also purchase superior quality feed. She hopes her piglets can grow faster. She has a plan to save all the profit for business capital.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn, 48, lives in a rural area of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married with six children, four of whom are dependents and still in school. 

The family’s main sources of income are from growing cassava and planting corn. She has been in this business for ten years. She is able to earn about 44,000KHR per day and she can manage to save about 22,000KHR each day after daily expenses.  

Chorn is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is asking for a loan of 4,000,000KHR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her agribusiness. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her agribusiness

loans.name: Munkhbukh

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbukh, 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is eleventh grade at high school and this year took a university entrance exam. His son goes to high school and is only in fifth grade. 

Munkhbukh, together with his wife began a raw materials sales business in 2005. They purchase bottles of alcohol, beer and juice, damaged bricks and other materials from people who collect them for a living. Later they sell them at higher price after making some adjustments such as repairing bricks or cleaning bottles. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation. So Munkhbukh is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the coming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is aged 60 years and married with five children. She lives in a rural village from the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia.

She and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living through raising pigs and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 18,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
 
Yen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yen is going to use her portion to buy more pigs for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Cruzloma  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cruzloma está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por un pueblito del cantón Paute, lugar que goza de mucha calma y paz, se disfruta de la naturaleza y su arquitectura es una mezcla de los moderno y lo antiguo. Su gente al igual que las socias aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a laborar en la crianza de animales, en la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jessica, se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Cruzloma, le gusta esta forma de crédito porque hay más unión entre todas las amigas del sector.

La Señora. Jessica tiene 29 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros.

Doña Jessica pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero le gusta mucho realizar actividades manuales, es por eso que ha recibido cursos sobre cómo realizar manillas, chompas y bufandas tejidas, trabaja en esta actividad todos los días y sus obras las vende a sus amigas y conocidas. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, pinturas y madejas de lana   que necesita. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The group Cruzloma consists of seven female members and one male member. They live in a small village in the canton of Paute. It is a very calm and peaceful place with a lot of natural beauty. Its architecture is a mixture of old and modern. The people, including the members of the group, keep to the culture and traditions of their villages and make a living by breeding animals, doing agricultural work, or working in the city of Cuenca.

One of the members of the group is Jessica. She is on her second loan cycle with her friends from borrower group Cruzloma. She likes this type of loan because there is more unity among all the friends in the sector.

Jessica is 29 years old and married. She has two children, who are ten and eight years of age. They are studying at a small school in the area. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They do not have their own house, so they live with her in-laws.

Jessica spends her time looking after her children, but she really likes doing hands-on activities; for this reason she has done courses on how to make knitted bracelets, sweaters, and scarves. She knits every day and sells her finished products to friends and acquaintances. She is going to invest her new loan in purchasing fabric, thread, paint, and skeins of wool.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, paint, and skeins of wool

loans.name: Sithan's Group

texts.en:
Sithan is aged 58 and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province and she has four children. To make a living, she has been in farming rice and supplements the family’s income by working at garment factory for 25 years, earning about 20,000KHR per day. 

Sithan’s group consists of two members who are both female and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. 

Sithan has used the first loan successfully to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Sithan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus dos pequeños hijos,a  quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; gracias a su esfuerzo Elizabeth pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Docencia en Educación Inicial.
Por iniciativa propia, Elizabeth trabaja como maestra de educación inicial en un centro educativo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demas.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá sus gastos de estudios para una especialización en docencia, de esta manera Elizabeth tendrá mayores posibilidades de ascenso profesional, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada que brinde bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her two small children, whom she loves and who are her main motivation in life. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into getting ahead in life with her children, since she is both a father and a mother to her children. Thanks to her efforts, Elizabeth was able to study Early Childcare Education.

On her own initiative, Elizabeth works as an early childcare education teacher in an educational centre in her city. She works every day for approximately ten hours and believes it is going well due to her good job performance and the kind way in which she treats others.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover her study expenses. In this way, Elizabeth will have greater possibilities of advancing professionally. She will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a safe and suitable home to ensure the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to cover education costs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia of Poblacion South Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte is married with three children. 

Her husband is a security guard while Sonia runs a general store selling groceries and school supplies. She has been in this business since she got married and it helps her to provide the basic needs of her family in addition to her husband’s salary.

With her unwavering ambition to become successful, she doesn’t feel tired of working before sunrise and late at night. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase school supplies like bond paper, pens, notebooks and pad paper. She plans to expand her business and hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies like bond paper, pens, notebooks and pad paper

location.town: Poblacion, South Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Corina Ada

texts.es:
Corina tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, es padre e 2 pequeños de 10 y 4 años a quienes saca adelante con el fruto de su trabajo. Corina alquila cuartos a los turistas que visitan su ciudad, al mes puede atender hasta 4 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes.

Corina está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá construir más cuartos para poder alquilarlos y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Corina is 30 years old. She lives in the city of Aguaytia. She has two children, who are ten and four years of age and whom she supports with the fruit of her labours. Corina rents out rooms to tourists who visit her city. Each month she can attend to four clients. She thinks her business is going well because she is kind to the clients.

Corina is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to build more rooms to rent out and thereby improve her earnings. This will allow her to continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality: “Giving her children a profession and improving their quality of life”.

loans.use: to build rooms

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is 30 years old and has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. As a rural villager from the Moung Russey district, she earns a living through planting rice. This is her only main source of the family’s income and she has been in this business for 10 years.

Rat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the past loans. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Rat will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and also use a portion of it to spend on buying gasoline for plowing the field. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Farming is their main source of income. 

Conchita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, Conchita will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her yield and profit. In the future, Conchita hopes of expanding her farm and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  KADIA  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi 1 Group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old with four children each, all of them living in polygamous families in N'Golokouna, a village in Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

The group members partner with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. The group is on its fourth loan with the MFI, and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crop is corn, to be grown by Mrs. Kadia, standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she plans to purchase labor, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain half [a hectare]. The crop will be sold in the village and in Sikasso after the harvest, to male and female customers.

Mrs. Kadia expects to see an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan, as well as to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase labor, farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chanthy is a 36-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming and pineapple have been the only source of her family’s income for ten years. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Chanthy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chanthy will use her portion to pay for labor costs. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. She is 52 years old and has four children. Her husband is a farmer and a part time carpenter. She helps him operate their own farm and has been doing so for over ten years, as a source of livelihood. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC and gained access to microfinance services.  She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer to have a high quality harvest from her rice farm.  She is grateful for this loan because it realizes their need of additional capital, for their business.  She hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jati Indah Group

texts.en:
The Jati Indah group, is a group of village women. They are joined in groups to get funding and training from MUK. Ni Wayan, is married and her husband is a farmer. Ni Wayan will use her loan to buy four pigs that will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. Remainder of the loan will be used to buy pig feed.

Ni Wayan spends 15,000 IDR for food daily and 100,000 IDR for electricity and water every month. Although her business is still small, Ni Wayan hope this business can support their children's education, buy books and other school supplies and kitchens tools.

loans.use: To purchase four pigs and feed

loans.name: Bat

texts.en:
Mr. Bat, 48 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on plot of land. He has been renting out public apartment to students for six years and secured many permanent customers. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and didn't get any renovation since he was always investing in his public apartments.

So Mr. Bat is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in comfortable and warm place without worrying about incoming winter. More importantly the family will burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme   NADINATA  assise en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi 2 Group are married women who, on average, are 44 years old and have six children, all of them living in polygamous families in N'Golokouna, a village in Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

The group members partner with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on its fourth loan with the MFI and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crop is corn, to be grown by Mrs. Nadinata, sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to pay for labor, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain half [a hectare]. The crop will be sold in the village and the market after the harvest to male and female customers.

Mrs. Nadinata expects to see an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to assist her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase labor, farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 33, is married, living with her family in a village of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last several years, Pov and her husband have been farming rice and selling coconuts to make a living. Together, they can earn about 25,000KHR per day from the current business.

Pov has been with VisionFund for eight years. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will use a part of it to buy coconuts for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.,

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single, 39-year-old mother of two children, ages 11 and 8, respectively. Ruth has been selling crisps for the past ten years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Ruth is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase five sacks of potatoes, 20 litres of cooking oil, and charcoal to make crisps in bulk. Ruth will invest the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to the college level and to secure their future, as well as live a sustainable life.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of potatoes, 20 litres of cooking oil, and charcoal to make crisps to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 25-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to eight years. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail store where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent store for her stock. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to increase her stock of potatoes for resale. Her business goal is to be a commercial seller of potatoes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate and feed her children comfortably.

loans.use: to increase her stock of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en: This is the fourth loan for the Nyuh Gading  group. They still need the financial support for their businesses, until they are able to build and use their own capital. . Ni Luh used her loan to purchase local piglets. She plans to sell piglets for pigroll.  Pig for pig bolsters require easier care than superior pigs and faster sales. She hopes her new plan, will be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase  local piglets

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 54 years old, lives with her oldest son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. Her other three children all got married and live on their own. Her husband passed away in 2006 and since then she has carried the burden of raising four children. She has been working as a crane operator at copper enrichment facility for thirty six years. Her oldest son has also worked as a serviceman at the same facility, for six years.

The apartment she and her son live in, has deteriorated over the years. So she is requesting a loan of 6000000 MNT to purchase hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, wallpaper, fiberglass and foam to renovate. By doing so she and her son will live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the family will burn less coal, release less pollutants and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass

loans.name: Yeny Paola

texts.es: Paola, a sus 21 años de edad, es madre de un bebé de 3 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, decidió realizar una técnica profesional en mercadeo y servicio al cliente; pero por falta de oportunidades laborales por no contar con experiencia, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio; desea montar un café internet, donde podrá poner en práctica sus conocimientos y tendrá la posibilidad de estar pendiente de su bebé, de esta forma generará ingresos para aportar económicamente para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Paola es una joven activa, enérgica, emprendedora, con proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, por lo que se anima a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de computadores y sillas, además adecuará el espacio para poner en marcha su idea de negocio. Esto le generará los recursos suficientes para poder solventar algunas necesidades básicas de su hogar y podrá cumplir el sueño de tener una fuente de ingresos que sea perdurable y sostenible en el tiempo, para que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida y disfrutarla al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Paola is 21 years old and the mother of a three-year-old baby. She and her partner are in a common-law relationship. After she finished high school, she decided to become a marketing and customer service professional, but she encountered few job opportunities because of the lack of experience. Paola decided to start her own business by opening an Internet café. This enables her to put her knowledge into practice while allowing her to keep an eye on her baby. Generating income will enable her to sustain her household financially.

Paola is an active, energetic, and enterprising young woman who is determined to complete her goals. For this reason, she is excited about requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of computers and chairs. She will also repurpose her space so that she can implement her business idea.

By generating sufficient income, Paola will be able to address some of her basic household needs. She will also accomplish her dream of having a source of income that is reliable and sustainable over time. As a result, she can have a better quality of life that she can enjoy along with her family.

loans.use: to buy computers and chairs and to pay for renovations to her space.

loans.name: Imoa

texts.en:
Imoa is a 48 year old married woman with 4 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Imoa has requested a loan to buy chain saw, chemicals, backpack sprayer, file and bushknife for her plantation business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Imoa hopes to improve her family standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chain saw, chemicals, backpack sprayer, file and bushknife

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single 51 year old mother of two.  She stays in Thika, Kenya.  Susan has been running a grocery store for the past fifteen years, with a monthly income of KES 13,000, which she uses to support her family. Susan is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, cabbage and carrots. She will use the additional income to reinvest in her business and improve the standard of living of her family. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, cabbage and carrots

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a 41 year old married father of seven from Thika, earns a living for his family by operating a tailoring shop. He has been in this business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,500 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his fifth loan from KADET LTD and he is grateful for the support he has been receiving which has made it possible to grow his business. He intends to use the loan to purchase more cloth to make clothes for his customers. Additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family and invest in his children’s education. 

He hopes to save money to educate his children to college level.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothes for his customers

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his town in Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than three years.
Joel is asking for a loan to buy more stock for his store, items like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. Through this loan, Joel will be able to improve the variety of his stocks thus allowing him to attract and cater to more buyers.
In the future, Joel hopes to expand his store and make it a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store - canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 35-year-old married man blessed with 5 children between the ages of 11 years and 6 months. He has been a livestock farmer for the past 10 years earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

He has received a loan from KADET LTD of 105,000 KES as his 6th term loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He wishes to use this amount to purchase more livestock for rearing and later for resale. The profits he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for rearing and resale.

loans.name: Aquiles Rafael

texts.es:
Aquiles es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, y día a día trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo como técnico de mantenimiento de máquinas de Gimnasios de su ciudad. 

Aquiles está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar algunos enseres para su hogar ya que actualmente no cuenta con ello, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio taller”.
texts.en:
Aquiles is a very hard-working man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa, and every day he works very hard in order to advance. It is for this reason that each day he works hard in his job as a maintenance technician for machines in gymnasiums in his city.

Aquiles is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy some furnishings for his house, since now he doesn't have any. Thus he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family, and he will continue striving to be able to realize his greatest dream: "to have his own workshop."

loans.use: to buy furnishings for his home

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 25-year-old man. He has one child who is three years old. He describes himself as creative. He operates a welding store in which he offers welding services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase his stock of metal sheets. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to increase his stock of metal sheets for his welding business.

loans.name: Kipchirchir

texts.en:
Kipchirchir is a 29-year-old married man and is blessed with one child, age 1 year. His spouse also helps him in income generation. He has been operating his retail general shop in Kapcholoi and has been in the business for 3 years, earning an income of 20,000 KES.

He is now receiving his 3rd loan of 130,000 KES with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, salt, tissue rolls, baking flour, and maize flour among other things for resale. The anticipated amount he will earn will be used to expand his current business.

His dream is improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She operates a retail shop where she sells soap, milk, bread, sugar, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be working long hours. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase her stock of milk, soap, bread, sugar, and other items she sells. Her business goal is to open a large store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: increase her stock of milk, soap, bread, sugar, and other items she sells.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of three children. Farming has been her source of income. Lydia helps her husband in cultivating their farm.

Now, Lydia needs a loan for her farm. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and to pay for farm labor, for her farm. As a result, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, which means increased yield and profit. In the future, Lydia dreams of making her farming venture a success and a stable source of income. She adds that she also wants to continue sending her children to school, for more learning and a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay farm laborers

loans.name: Rosita Jazmin

texts.es:
Rosita es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera,vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Rosita se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Industrial que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Rosita trabaja como analista de costura en una empresa textil de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas.
Rosita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará sus materiales de estudios y pagara la matricula de un nuevo ciclo académico,de esta manera ella podrá seguirá estudiando, así pues Rosita seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Rosita is a woman of 21. She is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Rosita is now studying for the professional career in industrial engineering that she desires.

On her own initiative, Rosita works as an sewing analyst in a textile business in her city. She works every day for about 8 hours. 

Rosita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will buy her school materials and pay the registration for a new academic term. In this way she will be able to continue studying, and therefore Rosita will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to cover her school expenses

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme DJENEBA debout en première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with six children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golokouna,  a village in Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Ms. DJENEBA is the featured member. She is standing in first position from right to left in the photo, and she cultivates corn.

With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres). After harvest the production is sold at village level and in the market  to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 90,000 CFA francs per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for plowing, agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  DIALIA  debout en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la  droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres). After harvest the production is sold at village level and in Sikasso  to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

Les membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme FATOUMATA debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The members of the Benkadi A group are married women who on average are 42 years old with six children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golokouna,  a village in Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Mrs. Fatoumata is the featured member. She is standing in the middle in the photo, and she cultivates corn.

With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres). After harvest the production is sold at village level and in Sikasso  to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 70,000 CFA francs per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for plowing, seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira, a sus 55 años de edad es casada, madre de 2 hijos que le han dado 4 nietos. Durante toda su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias, pues en la finca donde vivía tenía criadero de ganado bovino, porcino y avícola, lo que le generaba ingresos para apoyar al sustento de su hogar; pero por cuestiones de violencia, salió desplazada del pueblo donde vivía y, junto a su esposo y a sus hijos se radicaron en una casa cercana al municipio de bello, para comenzar desde cero. La casa donde reside actualmente tiene la ventaja de poseer un patio grande, donde ella ha podido retomar la cría y engorde de cerdos y aves para la posterior venta, de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, gracias a los ingresos que genera esta actividad.
