Deyanira es una mujer muy trabajadora, pujante y noble; a pesar de las dificultades de salud y económicas por las que ha pasado, siempre va buscando opciones que le permitan avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la adecuación del patio de su casa para ampliar los galpones y los corrales para los cerdos (alambre, madera, plástico) y comprará más polluelos y lechones, con el fin de tener más espacio para continuar con el cuidado de sus animales y poder sacar una producción escalonada, que le genere ingresos mensuales, y le permita seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de tener una granja; con la cual espera generar ingresos suficientes para seguir aportando a la manutención de su familia, mejorando la calidad de vida de todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Deyanira is 55 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She also has four grandchildren. Her entire productive life has been devoted to raising livestock. She had a farm where she raised cattle, pigs, and poultry in order to generate income to sustain her household. As a result of violence, Deyanira was displaced from the town where she lived. Along with her husband and children, she moved to a house near the town of Bello and started her life over from scratch. The house where she currently lives is advantageous because it has a large patio where she could return to raising and fattening pigs and chickens that could eventually be sold. This allows her to move her family forward as a result of the income she generates from her business.

Deyanira is a hardworking, strong, and noble woman. Despite the health and financial problems that she has experienced in the past, she always for looks for ways to make progress so that she can complete her goals. The reason for requesting is this loan is so that she can invest in repurposing the patio of her house in order to expand the chicken coops and pig pens (by purchasing wire, wood, and plastic). She will also buy more chicks and piglets. In the end, she will have more space to continue caring for her animals and staggering her production so that she can have a monthly income. By making these advances, Deyanira will fulfill her dream once again of having a farm. She hopes to generate sufficient income to continue supporting her family and improving the quality of life for her entire immediate family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and piglets and to buy construction materials for repurposing her patio to house larger chicken coops and pig pens.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 24 años y es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de técnica en enfermería, con lo cual pudo conseguir empleo en una pequeña farmacia de su ciudad, asimismo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra el cual utiliza para apoyar a su madre.

Monica está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como polos, pantalones, bividis, entre otros y así podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y lucha por hacer realidad su sueño, el cual es “tener una casa propia”
texts.en:
Monica lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is 24 years old and is a young woman with a great will to advance. With great effort, she managed to study for a career as a nursing technician, and with that she was able to find a job in a small pharmacy in her city.  She also began a business of selling clothing, from which she has some extra money that she uses to support her mother.

Monica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts, pants, and underwear, among other items, and thus she will have a greater variety of products to offer, which will allow her to improve her income and strive to make a reality of her dream, which is "to have her own house."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (polo shirts, among other items)

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old, married man. He has two children, who are 2 and 5 years old. He describes himself as focused. He operates a beauty service business; he performs manicures, applying Cutex to ladies' nails and also trimming their nails. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are women. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital to start a beauty parlor.

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to add to his stock of beauty products, e.g., Cutex. His business goal is to own a beauty parlor, within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to his stock of beauty products, e.g., Cutex for manicures

loans.name: Benkadi  B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N'GOLOKOUNA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme  SAFIATOU  assise en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi B group are married women who on average are 42 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in N'Golokouna,  a village in Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution  to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Mrs. Safiatou is the featured member. She is sitting in second position from right to left in the photo, and she cultivates corn.

With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for plowing, seeds and fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres). After harvest the production is sold at village level and in Sikasso  to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 65,000 CFA francs per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for plowing, seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Renzo Gustavo

texts.es:
Renzo es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Renzo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Diseño Gráfico que desea.
Por iniciativa propia,Renzo trabaja como operario de producción y corte en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Renzo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá mejorar parte de su vivienda, pues desea reforzar con materiales adecuados una habitación de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Renzo is a 21-year-old man, single and he lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, hard working and enthusiastic person with a great drive to improve himself. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Renzo has not been able to study graphic design as he wished. Out of his own initiative, Renzo works as a production and cutting operator for a company in the city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours a day and based on his performance he believes he's doing well.

Renzo is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since with their help he'll be able to improve part of his home. He wishes to use appropriate materials to reinforce a room in his home. He will continue working and making efforts to achieve his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Sara Vanessa

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 31 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y por iniciativa propia, Sara trabaja como auxiliar en un centro de salud de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un puesto de ventas de ropa, ella labra todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sara se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar y reforzar su puesto de ventas, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Sara is a 31-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pisco. She is a very cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts toward getting ahead. 

Thanks to her effort and through her own initiative, Sara works as an assistant in a health center in her city. Additionally, she has a clothing sales stall. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she believes that it’s going well for her due to her good performance and the kind treatment that she offers to others.

Sara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered, she will purchase construction materials to improve and reinforce her sales stall. In this way, she will continue working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream of having a big boutique.

loans.use: to improve her sales stall.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 43 years old, married and blessed with two children. Zenaida raises hogs for future sale. She usually makes PHP 3,000 for each hog that she sells. She wants to keep increasing the hogs’ growth, which is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicine for the hogs.

She hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and someday sell them profitably. She will save her income for her family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the hogs

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nathalie est vice présidente d’une association d’affaire  « Mizeituni»,jeune entrepreneur expérimentée,âgée de 35 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l'administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de braises. Elle installe ses produits dans un coin du marché public et parfois, à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a environ 3 ans.Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
The member Nathalie is vice president of a business association named "Mizeituni". She is a young but experienced entrepreneur, 35 years of age and mother of six children, all attending school. Her husband is a government officer. 

The member sells charcoal. She displays her wares in a corner of the public market and sometimes at her home. She started her business with her own funds received from her husband, about three years ago.

This new loan will be used to buy three bags of charcoal. Her intent is to expand her business, educate and feed her children.

To conclude, she strongly thanks Hekima for its microcredit support to small non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of charcoal

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
Marlith tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, junto a ella vive su esposo, a quien quiere mucho y juntos tiene 8 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Marlith se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como agricultora, en su parcela ha sembrado maíz, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que siempre está al pendiente de ver cómo crece el cultivo.

Marlith está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le han brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, gastos de regadío, entre otros, así  podrá tener una mejor cosecha y seguir luchando para poder salir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida y ser una gran agricultora”.
texts.en:
Marlith is 54 years old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa along with her husband, whom she loves very much. Together, they have 8 children who are already grown. 

Every day, Marlith makes an effort to get ahead. For this reason, she works as a farmer; she plants corn on her plot of land. She works at this business around 9 hours per day, as she is always keeping an eye on how her harvest is growing. 

Marlith is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders have offered to her, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy fertilizer and manure and pay irrigation expenses, among others. In this way, she will have a better harvest and continue fighting to get ahead and make her greatest dream a reality: “To improve her quality of life and be a great farmer”.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer and to pay irrigation expenses, among others.

loans.name: Jack Miguel

texts.es:
Jack tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es padre de un pequeño de 9 meses de edad, al que quiere mucho y está esforzándose por salir adelante y poder brindarle una buena calidad de Vida, es por ello que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo como tapicero en una pequeña empresa de confección de muebles de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día.

Jack está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá construir una pequeña habitación en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller de carpintería”.
texts.en:
Jack is 21 years old, he lives in the city of Pucallpa, and he's the father of a little 9 month old boy who he loves very much. He is making an effort to get ahead and provide his son with a high quality of life. This is why he works hard as an upholsterer in a small furniture making business in the city. He works about 9 hours a day and he can take care of up to 15 clients in a day.

Jack is very thankful for the support he receives from Kiva lenders. With their help he will be able to build a small room in his home, which will improve his family's quality of life. He will continue his efforts to make his greatest dream of having a carpentry workshop a reality.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.en: Melquiades is hoping to increase his income from fish selling for the overall welfare of his family. In this regard, he is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. With his patience in doing the business, he acquires 2,000 PHP net income each month from the business, with the aid of his motorcycle which he uses go around his village to sell. His earned income helps him sustain his family needs.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 49 years old and single. She lives in a rural community and aims to become successful and financially stable in the future. She's into selling fruits and vegetables in her village. She aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to generate a higher income. Due to limited capital, she is asking for a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to purchase more stocks of vegetables, fruits, flour, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients needed to be cooked and sold in her community. Through hard work and determination, she believes that she will further improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables, fruits and flour, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients needed to be cooked and sold.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Lolita has been in the farming industry for more than three years now. She helps her husband in overseeing their farm.

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm. Lolita believes that through hard work and with the help of a loan, her dreams of experiencing fullness of life through her farming business will become possible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es originario de la ciudad del viejo chinandega. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de panes, alquiler de sillas, mesas y el negocio de pulpería, que con mucho  esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicacion ha  sacado adelante, tiene como mayor apoyo a su esposa. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que gracias al financiamiento ha logrado salir adelante, obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejor calidad de vida . Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pasta dental, papel higienico, etc, con el fin de surtir su pulpería y satisfacer las necesidades de sus cliente.
texts.en:
Julio is originally from the city of Old Chinandega. He is a merchant by trade who sells bread and manages a store. He also rents out tables and chairs. With great effort, work, and dedication, Julio has been able to get ahead with his wife who is his greatest supporter. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito since the loans have helped him to move forward, generate more income, and improve his quality of life.

Julio is requesting a loan so that he can buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, toilet paper, and other items in order to restock his store and satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
With same loan amount and the same members, the Karanjung Lestari 1 group continues their loan with MUK. This lending period, the loan will be used to purchase more superior piglets and feed and to renovate the barn.

Ni Made already renovated her barn. Now the pigs do not run away at her yard anymore. It’s made her house more clean. Getting full support from her husband, Ni Made will use the loan to purchase feed only, because from the last loan, she used the profit to purchase piglets also. She hopes this time for more success, more happiness and more profit. She also has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en: Ana Marie is married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a rural community. Her husband cultivates their farm by planting rice and some vegetables while Ana Marie is the one selling their products in the market to supplement their family's daily needs and for the education of their children. She aims to acquire more stocks of vegetables to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds of eggplants, string beans, okra, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, carrots, garlic and cabbages to sell. She is hoping that her loan will help improve their business so that they can earn a bigger profit in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of eggplants, string beans, okra, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, carrots, garlic and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 35-year-old woman. She has two children with ages 3 years and 5 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be network problems. 

She will use the 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add M-pesa float (stored-value credits for sale in mobile money service). This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float for her money-transfer business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 64-year-old woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 18 years to 42 years. She describes herself as dependable. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers to help grow more tea bushes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers to help grow more tea bushes

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has two children who are 11 and 12 years old. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a poultry business where she raises chickens to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to add more chickens and buy feed, etc. Her business goal is to start more businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business lady. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans of KES 50,000 were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Flossy

texts.en:
Flossy is a 29-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a secretarial shop where she sells stationery and offers photocopying services. She has been involved in this business for one year. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of labor and funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy stock of stationery for resale, i.e., printing papers, pens, books, etc. Her business goal is to be a large-scale operation within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of stationery for resale, i.e., printing papers, pens, books, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 61-year-old widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 18 years to 36 years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are small scale. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers to help grow more tea bushes. Her business goal is to be a large scale tea farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers to help grow more tea bushes.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mashauri est conseillère  d’une association de crédit « Neema »,  entrepreneur majeur, expérimentée, âgée de 46 ans  et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Son conjoint est un chômeur.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central et parfois,  à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le soutien financier du projet de microcrédit de Hekima. Il y a environ 20 ans, elle exerce ce business. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 25 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir et construire pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The client, Mashauri, is advisor of a borrower group, “Neema,” and a serious, experienced entrepreneur, who is 46 years old and mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. The client is a shoe seller. Her spouse is unemployed. She sells her merchandise at the central market and sometimes from home. She started her business with her own money, which she got from her husband. Later, she benefitted from the financial support of the microcredit program Hekima. About 20 years ago, she started this business. This new loan will help her to buy 25 pairs of shoes. Thus, she hopes to grow her business and to educate, feed, and build for her children. She greatly thanks Hekima for its support via microcredit for non-bankable small businesses.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de una pequeña a la cual quiere mucho ya que es lo más importante que tiene en la vida y por ello se esfuerza por salir adelante, así Maria trabaja como obrera de un fundo agrícola, asimismo ha logrado iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de bebidas como cervezas al por mayor, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio de mejor manera y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder darle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and she's the mother of a little girl whom she loves very much. Her daughter is the most important thing in Maria's life, which is why she works hard to get ahead. 

Maria's employed as a farm worker, while at the same time she's managed to start a small business selling carbonated drinks and beer. This provides her with extra money and with the rest of her efforts she is able to settle her home expenses. 

Maria is very thankful to Kiva lenders. With their help she could purchase wholesale merchandise for her business, such as drinks like beer.This way she could better supply her business and improve her income. She will continue working to make her greatest dream, having a house of her own and providing her daughter with a good education, a reality.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (beers)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a married woman. She has three children who range in age from two to six years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of feed and limited capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and more milk for resale. Her business goal is to be a well known dairy farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and more milk for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys, 26 years old, is married and blessed with four kids. Her husband is a small farmer from the village of Union, in the province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling different vegetables and fruits. Early in the morning, she makes sure that she prepares breakfast for her family. Her business is located in front of their house. Gladys hopes that she can save enough money to build their own house and to have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy squash, tomatoes, beans and fruits to sell

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en: Phyllis is a 59 year old woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 29 to 40. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances and the dry season. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farming items. Her business goal is to be financially stable and increase production within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farming items

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school and one is underage. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She has a green grocery business that she has been doing for five years now. Her greatest challenge is inflation on her products. With a loan of KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase onions, vegetables, tomatoes, cooking oil and maize. She joined Yehu to access loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase onions, vegetables, tomatoes, cooking oil and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soap, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is married with three children living in Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. Her husband is a farmer and a part-time carpenter to earn a living. She helps him operate their own rice farm, their main source of income. She joined Gata Daku MPC this year and requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and cover maintenance costs.  She plans to cultivate a vacant lot to have a better harvest in return. With her determination to have a better future, she works patiently and she wholeheartedly supports her husband for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cover maintenance costs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of one child, lives in Bandera, Polanco, Zamboang Del Norte. Her husband is a construction worker while Myrna manages their own rice farm to make a living. In addition to doing this, she also runs a “sari sari” store selling home use products to gain an extra income. Recently, she needed to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance labor costs for her rice production.  Without hesitation, she borrowed  7,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC which she had joined this year. She hopes to generate more revenue to save for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance labor costs for her rice production

loans.name: Camelita

texts.en: Camelita is a 24 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a boutique where she sells shoes and clothes among other things. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase shoes and clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 30 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages two and half years and nine years. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a retail stall where he sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Diloro

texts.ru: Дилоро молодая девушка в возрасте 19 лет. Она живет с матерью и братом в городе Душанбе. Ее мать работает в Микрокредитной организации в отделе кадров, а брат учится в школе в 11-ом классе. Дилоро в прошлом году успешно окончила школу. В этом году она решила осуществить свою мечту и поступить в Университет. Дилоро очень интересуется дизайнерской работой. Она хочет учиться и развиваться в этом направлении. Поэтому недостающую сумму она просит в кредит. Дилоро хочет оплатить за первый год обучения в Технологическом Университете. Она очень старательная девушка. В дальнейшем она хочет еще и заняться изучением иностранных языков.
texts.en: Diloro is a young woman at the age of nineteen. She lives together with her mother and brother in the city of Dushanbe. Her mother works in the Microcredit organization in the human resources department and her brother is in the eleventh grade of school. Diloro has successfully completed school last year. This year she has decided to make her dream come true and enrolled in the university. Diloro is very interested in the job of a designer. She wants to study and grow in this direction. This is why she is asking for a loan to cover the needed amount. Diloro wants to pay for the first year of tuition in the Technological University. She is a very diligent young woman. In the future she wants to study foreign languages.

loans.use: to pay for first year tuition at the university.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 to 26. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 17 years. His primary customers are government workers . He describes his biggest business challenge to be shipping of products to customers' houses/offices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more timber to make more products. His business goal is to export his products within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will become an international businessman.

loans.use: to buy more timber to make more products

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, seven of whom are in school, Gaudencia works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming root crops. Gaudencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell for her business.

Gaudencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 5 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Elsa no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios.
Por iniciativa propia, Elsa trabaja como personal de limpieza en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Elsa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado de su hogar, de esta manera ella brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Elsa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old and lives in the city of Nazca with her 5 children whom she loves and who are her pride and joy. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts in a lot of effort to make life better for her family. Unfortunately due to lack of resources and because she needed to work from a very young age she was not able to finish her primary school education. On her own initiative, Elsa works as a cleaner in a municipal firm in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and believes things are going well for her because of her hard work and determination.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the support she is getting she will be able to improve her home. She wants to reinforce the roof on her home and this will improve the security and wellbeing of her family. Elsa will continue to work hard to achieve her biggest dream of completing the construction of her home.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Erick Alex

texts.es:
Erick es un hombre de 27 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Erick pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Erick trabaja en el ara de recursos humanos de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Erick se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará una habitación de su vivienda, la pintará, le pondrá piso de concreto y otros, de esta manera Erick desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Erick who is 27 years old is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great drive to get on in life. Thanks to his own hard work and the support of his parents, Erick was able to study for a professional career in business administration. Through his own initiative, he works in the human resources department of a commercial company in the city. He works every day for around 12 hours and thinks things are going well for him because he works hard and has a good way of dealing with other people. 

Erick is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the support he is being given he will be able to improve a room in his house. He wants to paint it and put down a concrete floor and make other improvements. In this way Erick hopes to improve the security and wellbeing of his family. He will continue working hard to achieve his biggest dream of having his own company.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Jorge Jose

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa al lado de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad. Cada Jorge se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, ya que de él depende que sus hijos puedan alimentarse cada día ya que el es el único sustento de su hogar, es por ello que trabaja como vigilante,  en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable.

Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su hogar ya que actualmente cocina a leña, y con esta mejora evitar accidentes, sobre todo por seguridad de sus hijos, así el seguirá esforzándose por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:2 Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jorge, 28, lives in the city of Pucallpa together with his children, who are three and one year old. Jorge fights every day to get ahead, since it is his responsibility to bring food to the table and he is the only source of income for his family. He works as a security guard for a small company in his city. He works around nine hours every day and he believes that he is getting ahead because he is a responsible person.

Jorge appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will buy a gas stove to replace the one he has, which uses wood. This improvement will result in fewer accidents and will be safer for his children. He will continue to work in order to make his dream come true: “to give his children a good education and to have his own house.”

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa is a married woman with three children, who are all in school. She lives in her own house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees.

With the Ksh 100,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cereal such as rice, maize, beans, cooking oil, and sacks of sugar for resale. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cereal such as rice, maize, beans, cooking oil, and sacks of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Yabu

texts.en:
Yabu is a single woman with no children. She stays in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been operating a tailoring business for the last three years. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. She cites inflation as her major challenge.

With the Ksh 40,000 she wants to purchase a tailoring machine and fabric for her business. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Mr. Dorjpalam, 69 years old, lives with his daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making horse hair fiddles since 2005 and sells them to local retail shops. His daughter works at a private business company. 

Due to lack of finance, his daughter is postponing her graduate education in Germany. So Dorjpalam is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to pay for his daughter's living expenses in Germany. After studying in Germany, his daughter will be able succeed in her career and that's what he wants.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his daughter

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en: Victorino manages a 4,000 square meter fish pond, a one hectare rice field, and he also manages a hog-raising business. He is grateful because through his perseverance and determination, he was able to keep his agriculture business well. He is happily married and blessed with three children. To maintain the hogs and ensure they have proper care and nutrition, Victorino is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. This will serve as additional capital in his  hog-raising business, enabling him to buy the necessary requirements for the business like hog feed, vaccines, and vitamins. Victorino is doing his best to have healthier livestock for fattening and to deal the hogs to buyers at a reasonable price.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for his hog-raising and to buy the necessary requirements for the business like hog feed, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, 48 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has managed a hog-raising business for almost 20 years. With this business Rosita earns a net income of PHP 2,500 when she sells one hog. Due to insufficient funds she would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hogs and hog feed. Rosita is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can further grow her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feed

loans.name: Felizarda

texts.en:
Felizarda is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 6 years now. This is their main source of income.
Felizarda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Felizarda hopes of making their fishing venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 36 years old and married to Joseph who is a public service vehicle driver. Both of them support a family of three. 

Diana runs a general goods retail shop in the Chepterit trading center in Nandi, Kenya. This has been her income-generating business for the last year. From this business, she earns an average monthly income of KES 8,000. She has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000, which she plans to use to purchase maize flour, cooking fat, sugar, rice, face towels and handkerchiefs among other items for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to pay her children’s school fees. 

Diana's dreams are to meet her family's financial needs, and have a happy and healthy relationship with her family members free of financial challenges.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking fat, sugar, rice, face towels and handkerchiefs among other items for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old lady who is married to Paul. She is a mother of lovely twins, who are both 10 years old. She learned about KADET from a loan officer who was running a marketing campaign in her area of business operation.

Elizabeth runs a business selling and milling cereals in a posho mill. She makes approximately KES 90,000 from the business on a monthly basis. She has acquired a second loan of KES 100,000, which will help her purchase bulk produce from the farmers this harvesting season.

Elizabeth will use the proceeds to educate her lovely children as well as reinvest in her business. Her dream is to own a car that will aid her transportation needs.

loans.use: to buy more cereals from farmers for her business.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en: Aurelio is a hog-raiser in the village of Paddad, Alicia. He is now 53 years old, married, and has three children. He has been raising pigs for many years. To meet his family's daily needs, he brings out his best in managing his hog-raising business. He has a breeding pig that provided him 12 piglets when it gave birth; he usually sells each piglet for about PHP 2,500. As of now, Aurelio is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins needed to maintain his pigs. These supplies will greatly help him support the continuous development of the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins needed to maintain his pigs.

loans.name: Wendy Josellu Melchora

texts.es:
Wendy es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Wendy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Wendy trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Wendy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara una habitación de su vivienda, reforzándola con materiales adecuados y resistente, de esta manera podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de tener una casa segura y adecuada.
texts.en: Wendy is twenty years old, and lives in the town of Ica, with her two small children, whom she adores and who are her main reason for living. A very amiable, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, she dedicates all her efforts to making her family pull through, since she is raising her children on her own. Unfortunately, because of her lack of financial resources, Wendy had to start working at an early age, and was thus unable to pursue a career. On her own initiative, she works as a farm labourer for an agricultural cooperative in her city. She works about ten hours per day and attributes her success to her hard and capable work. Wendy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, she will be able to improve her house by reinforcing it with appropriate and resistant materials. Her family will thus lead a more secure, better life. Wendy will keep working and giving her all in order to make her greatest dream of having a safe and decent house come true.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Cefirina

texts.en:
Cefirina is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cefirina is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment.

Cefirina has been farming vegetables for 24 years, and also earns additional income from buy & sell root crops, spices and vegetables businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rio works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rio is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell for her fruits and vegetables business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Rio has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a 50-year-old woman with 6 children living in Hoima, Uganda. Gorret practices a livestock-farming business which she has run for over ten years now, and she also earns a salary as a civil servant. Diseases and the high cost of medicine are her major challenge, while her dreams are to own a ranch and a milk processing plant. Being the good mother that she is, Gorret desires to educate her children up to university. Gorret intends to use the loan to buy an exotic cattle breed for rearing.

loans.use: to buy an exotic cattle breed for rearing

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with four children. Three are in school and one is below school age. Fatuma lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Fatuma operates a juice-making business where she makes soft drinks from fruit and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.
With the loan of KES 20,000, Fatuma wants to purchase sugar and fruit to make her juice.
She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and fruit to make her juice

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He mainly grows tea and maize alongside operating a retail shop in order to boost his income. With his profits he has been able to acquire a piece of land. 

Augustine has a vision of expanding his tea plantation, despite facing challenges of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital. Augustine is requesting a loan to buy tea seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman. She has three children, two of whom attend school while one is below school age. Mwanamisi owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamisi has operated a vegetable stall business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 Mwanamisi wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale.
She joined Yehu in order to access funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother and has four children in school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are the school fees for her children. 

For the past 11 years, Fatuma has operated a snack-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. 

With the KES 20,000, Fatuma wants to purchase sacks of snacks to resell at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of snacks to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man who is 49 years old. He has four children and lives in Hoima, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture, he started farming by growing rice and maize 10 years ago after raising capital from making and selling bricks. He has been able to open a store for selling produce to supplement his farming business and he also has continued to farm. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house for the family. Weather and bad roads affect his business. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy more produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Perenlei

texts.en: Mr. Perenlei, 27 years old, lives with his wife, child and parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2006. His father is a carpenter and his mother is a bookkeeper. Using his previous loan, he finished building his new house. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase hardwood floors and vacuum-insulated windows. After installing the hardwood floors and vacuum insulated windows, his family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place. Also, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: To purchase hardwood floors and vacuum-insulated windows to improve his house.

loans.name: Balel

texts.fr: Madame Balel est une femme très brave, elle est âgée de 55ans et mère de 06 enfants dont le plus grand à 30ans et le plus petit 7ans. Il habite à 11 km du Guichet et elle est à son 2ième prêt. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins qu'elle élève et les revendre. Madame Balel aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la maison. Elle commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 10h. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus en diversifiant son activité et pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs Balel is a very good woman, she is 55 years old and has six children of which the oldest is 30 and the youngest seven. She lives 11 kilometres from the bank office and this is her second loan. She requests this loan to buy chickens that she fattens up before selling. Mrs Balel helps her husband with the daily household expenses. She starts her day at 06 am and works until 10 pm. She hopes to increase her earnings by diversifying her activity to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten them up and resell them.

loans.name: Maria  Cecilia

texts.en: Maria Cecilia is 29 years old and has three school-age children. She maintains a general store for a living. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, detergent soaps and sugar to sell in her store. With the business, she hopes to contribute in upgrading their standard of living in order to give their children a better life. If her loan request is granted, she will use the loan to  improve her business product offerings to increase her daily income.

loans.use: to buy assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, detergent soaps and sugar to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en: Patrocenia is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her food-vending business. She cooks and sells home cooked snack foods to people in her area. Patrocenia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk and oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk and oil for her food production business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is married with six children and lives Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. Her husband is a farmer and a part-time carpenter while she runs a sari-sari store. She has run the store for the past five years to earn a living. Since getting married, she has been helping her husband operate their own rice farm, which is their main source of income. Recently, she has needed to buy additional inventory for her store with items such as canned goods, noodles, and sweetened products to sell. She joined Gata Daku MPC this year, and without hesitation she borrowed a loan of 7,000 PHP to add to her capital. She hopes to have multiple harvests from their farm and be able to generate additional income with her business to save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: buy additional inventory for her store with items such as canned goods, noodles, and sweetened products to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials. She has been in this business for five years. Marichu earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her fishing business. Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena, a 36-year-old mother of two, lives in Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte. Her husband works as a plumber in a private construction company to earn a living. She runs a small grocery store in addition to her husband’s income to augment their living. She is determined to save money for the future of her children so she keeps on selling goods in the community to realize her dream. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she has joined recently to buy dried fish and bagoong (salted fish) for sale. She hopes to gain more income to be use for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and bagoong (salted fish) for sale

loans.name: Gregoria Escarly

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa al lado de sus padres.  Gregorio con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de contabilidad y gracias a ello logro conseguir empleo en una institución de su ciudad y con los ingresos que le brinda su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.

Gregoria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar los tramites de su bachiller, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus condiciones laborales y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad sus más grande sueño:”  Tener un mejor empleo y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 27 years old and lives with her parents in the city of Pucallpa. With hard work, Gregoria was able to graduate as an accountant, which helped her to find a job in a local institution. With her income she helps her parents with the home expenses.

Gregoria is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to pay for the formalization of her degree. This will results in better working conditions and will help her to continue fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “to have a better job and help her family.”

loans.use: to formalize her degree.

loans.name: Urselina

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, two of whom are in school, Urselina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Urselina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, toothpaste, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Urselina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, toothpaste, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred lives in the Mariakani area, which is a few kilometers from the Mombasa - Nairobi highway. She is 30 years old, married, and blessed with four children. For the last two years, she has been running a food cafe. The business has grown enough to employ three people. She has a vision of opening branches of her cafe in other locations. Her husband supports her in the business, and she wants the business to be a stable one. She seeks a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She knew about Milango through friends, and she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund her food cafe. The extra income that she raises from the business will go far in helping her to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar for her food cafe.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr:
Zuhura fait partie du groupe  Rafiki  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée  à Eric, un coiffeur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 16 ans dont 2 étudient.
Elle fait le commerce des habits et des chaussures    depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait renouveler son domicile et avoir sa propre place pour exercer le commerce.
texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Rafiki group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 33 years old and married to Eric, a hairdresser. They have three children between the ages of one and sixteen of which two attend school.

She has been selling shoes and clothing for six years.

This is her sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she intends to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothes that she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years she would like to renew her dwelling and have her own premises for her commerce.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothes to resell to earn more.

loans.name: Allah Group

texts.fr:
Mme BIBATA est responsable du groupe ALLAH. Mariée, elle est sans enfant et n’a  personne en charge.
Mme fait la coiffure depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sankaryaar. Ses clients sont partout dans les environs.
Elle veut s’acheter 20paquets de mèches et 30 tissages.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un compte d’épargne. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un salon de coiffure et aider son mari avec les charges familiale.
texts.en:
Mrs Bibata is the leader of the Allah group. She is married without children and has no dependants.
She has been a hairdresser for six years. She buys her material at the market in Sankaryaar. Her clients come from all over the region.
She would like to buy 20 packets of hair locks and 30 braids.
Mrs Bibata would like to use her profits to open a savings account. She hopes to open a hairdressing salon and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of hair locks and 30 braids.

loans.name: Sect 28 Wendlasida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est responsable du groupe SECT 28 WENDLASIDA. Veuve, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 39ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va a l’école  et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend du dolo depuis 35ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bendgo. Ses clients sont partout dans les environs.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs et ½ de céréale (sorgho) pour la préparation du dolo.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’acheter un terrain (parcelle).
texts.en:
Mrs Mariam is the leader of the SECT 28 WENDLASIDA group. She is a widow with six children. The oldest is 39 and the youngest 20 years old. None of her children attend school and she has one person who is dependent on her.
Mrs Mariam has been selling beer for 35 years. She buys her products at the market in Bendgo. Her customers come from all over the surrounding area.
She would like to buy two and a half sacks of sorghum to prepare the beer.
Mrs Mariam wants to use the profits to reinforce her activity. She aims to expand her business and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 2 1/2 sacks of sorghum to make beer.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baasankhuu, 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been running a bathhouse for a couple of years and has secured many permanent customers. The house they live in has been deteriorating and he wants to completely replace the old roof with a new one and make an extension. 

So he is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as shingles, bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his old house. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn too much coal for heating. Reduction in usage of coal will certainly contribute to the well-being of the environment.

loans.use: To purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz runs a sari-sari or variety store, selling a variety of goods to the people of her community. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has eight children. Maria Luz is applying for a loan to buy groceries to sell in her store, such as soap and toiletries, noodles, canned goods, bread and snack foods, as well as fertilizer for her farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stock and increase the productivity of her farm. Maria Luz dreams of making her businesses a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store, such as soap and toiletries, noodles, canned goods, bread and snack foods, and to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 52 years old and has been blessed with nine children. Three of them are still in college. They reside in a rural community and make their living from farming and a simple business selling clothing. She aims to strengthen the business by acquiring more stock to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy assorted clothing, including tee-shirts, blouses, pants, jackets, slippers, bags and socks, to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help further improve her clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing, including tee-shirts, blouses, pants, jackets, slippers, bags and socks, to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita is a hog raiser at Amulung and has seven children. Some of her children are already married, while others are still living with them. To help her spouse acquire income, she went into the business of raising hogs and selling them. She usually gets PHP 3,000 net income per hog she sells. She wants the business to be more profitable and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustainability.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs' sustainability

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a 38-year-old man from the town of Anda, Bohol. He has been involved in the hog-raising business for more than two years. Antonio is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP, which he will use to buy more piglets to raise, and feed for the pigs. His profit from the business will definitely help him to meet his daily needs and to reinvest in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Bozo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames, les six membres du groupe Bozo ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de fruits, légumes, produits cosmétiques, pagnes wax et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatouma (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes de qualité. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 18 pièces de pagnes wax  à Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatouma espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Bozo group are women with an average are of 34 and, on average, 2 children, who are mostly married and living in monogamous households. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the main town of the district located in the circle of Kati (in the second administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and family relationships. The group members sell fruit, vegetables, beauty products, wax pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African cloth) and charcoal. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan.

Fatouma (sitting on the left in the picture) is a large seller of quality pagnes. She plans to use her loan to buy 18 bolts of wax pagnes in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash or credit in Kalaban Coro to a clientèle mainly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Fatouma hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Maraka Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogames, les quatre femmes du groupe Maraka ont en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits et légumes, du fonio précuit, des produits cosmétiques et de la couture avec la vente de vêtements. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 rouleaux de fils, un litre d’huile d’entretien pour la machine et 10 pièces de pagne wax. Elle se ravitaille en gros au grand marché en ces matériaux. La revente des habits cousus se fait  au comptant et à crédit dans son atelier à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. En plus de ça, elle gagne beaucoup dans la couture des habits de sa clientèle. Madame Djènèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle ambitionne acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso/ Kiva.
texts.en:
The 4 women of the Maraka group have an average of 35 and, on average, 5 children, and are all married and living in monogamous households. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the main town of a district located in the circle of Kati (in the second administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. The group members are small retailers of fruit, vegetables, pre-cooked fonio (a species of millet), beauty products and sewing services, including clothing sales. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan.

Djènèba (sitting on the far right in the picture) plans to use her loan to buy 10 rolls of thread, one litre of oil for the maintenance of her machine and 10 bolts of wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). She gets her supplies from the wholesalers at the Grand Market. She resells the clothes she makes for cash or credit in her workshop in Kalaban Coro to a clientèle mainly made up of women. She also earns a lot sewing clothes for her customers. Thanks to this loan, Djènèba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business. She aims to buy property destined for habitation whilst working with Soro Yiriwaso and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is widow and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a transportation services business. While it is not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle-transport services. She also provides manicures and pedicures in their community to earn extra income. She has been doing this for ten years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which helped keep her business running. After she joined Gata Daku MPC, her ability to engage business was improved, as was her quality of life. She also gained access to microfinance services and was able to take out a new loan to buy a new manicure and pedicure set, with a portion being used to buy tires for her motorcycle. She is hopeful that, with this new beauty set, she will gain more clients and generate more income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a new manicure and pedicure set and to buy tires for the motorcycle she uses in her transport business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a married mother of five children who lives in Baybay Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City, with her family. Luzminda and her husband have been working together to operate their own general store and  make a living. She has been doing this for more than 15 years, earning 20,000 PHP monthly. She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, and it helped them to improve their living situation. She took out a new loan in order to buy additional products, such as dried fish and bagoong (salted fish) to sell. She hopes that this will help to pay for her children’s education and for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional products, such as dried fish and bagoong (salted fish), to sell.

loans.name: Elda Jane

texts.en:
Elda Jane is married with three sons and lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband works as a  driver and operator of their motorcycle transportation business while she is engaged with her 'buy and sell' business to earn a living. Her husband personally offers transportation services in their locality.  The family gains extra income from this. 

Elda Jane has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC and is now requesting a new loan to cover the costs of motorcycle repair and maintenance. Her dream is to see her children finish their education and with their hope and determination, success is at hand.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Divino

texts.en:
This is Divino, 40, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He is married Pilita, a teacher, and they have children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Divino oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business. They have one jeepney that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

Divino dreams to buy another jeepney and hopes to give his children a quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit for their transportation business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Emelita works hard to support her family. She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Emelita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to process for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is applying for a new loan to further build her businesses. Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
This is Felisa, 43, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Armando, a jeepney driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety store business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses on a continuous basis.
