In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by acquiring supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day. She is applying for a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Felisa hopes to have a grocery store some day, and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es:
Betsy es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo, ella es una persona muy amble, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación,Betsy trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de venta de ropa para niños de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Betsy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una cocina, la cual reemplazará a su cocina de kerosene que presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Betsy is a 21 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband. She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all of her effort into getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and because she has to work, she hasn't been able to go to college. 

On her own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Betsy works selling children's clothes in a store in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and she thinks it is going well for her because of her hard work.

Betsy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given she will buy a stove to replace her kerosene stove that has flaws and is dangerous to use. She will keep working and striving to make her big dream come true of going to college.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, ya que con este oficio puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 cliente de manera diaria, el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar artefactos para su domicilio ya que debido a un robo perdió todo y de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 21 year old young man who works as a motorcycle taxi driver. With this work he is able to earn income to cover his expenses. He works around 10 hours a day and can serve around 20 customers a day. He thinks that he is getting ahead because he is very friendly to his customers. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he will be able to buy appliances for his home. He lost everything in a robbery, and this way he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as milk, noodles, spices and  eggs. Eufemia has been in this business for four years. Eufemia earns additional income from selling vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her general store and her vegetable business. Eufemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in hr store, including soap, milk, noodles, spices and eggs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy coffee, sugar, snack foods and other groceries to sell in her store. Elsie has been in this business for five years. Elsie earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as coffee, sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling 'nipa' (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional nipa to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loans, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her nipa business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell 'nipa' (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair)

loans.name: Amnas' Group

texts.en: A resident of a rural village in the Dambae district, Amnas is the 38-year-old mother of seven children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. The family’s income comes mainly from growing cashew nuts and planting cassava. The current businesses earn her about 21,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Amnas has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully paid back the previous loan from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for loans of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farm, and she will also use a portion of it to spend on labor and plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a Ugandan, age 32 and married, who has three children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He offers cleaning services in local government offices and is very committed to his work. He also earns money from farming to supplement his income. He hopes to educate all his children up to the university and to set up other income-generating activities in order to meet his increasing family expenses. Robert intends to use the loan to start a retail shop.

loans.use: to start up a retail shop.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Nang is 47 years old and married. She and her husband have seven children. They earn a living through planting cassava and raising pigs; they have been in this business for almost thirty years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 35,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the first loan for Nang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Nang is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, pay labor fees, and buy pig feed. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it at a good price so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 29, lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and she is married with three children, who are all still in school. The family’s main sources of income are from planting cassava and farming rice while her husband is a paid construction worker. She has been in this business for two years. 

Sopha has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve her likelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and use a portion to pay on labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Makara is aged 32 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and she has two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She is a farmer who grows cassava and also complements that income by selling grocery items. She has been with these businesses for ten years.

Makara has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has used the first loans successfully to better support her family. Now she is asking for another loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Leang is 43 and lives in a rural village in Cheung Prey district, Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has one dependent child to take care of. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice; she has been in this business for 23 years. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Leang just started with VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem, aged 30, is a rural villager from the Ponhea Krek district. She earns a living by cultivating cassava. This is the main source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for seven years. To supplement their income, her husband also works for others, for a fee. Together, they can earn about 32,000 KHR per day to meet their family’s needs.
 
Saem has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the previous loans. They helped her to improve her living conditions. Now she is applying for another loan, which she will use to buy a plot of farmland to expand her agricultural business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more cassava, and she hopes to sell the crops for a good price.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland, to expand her cassava fields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tendre La Main Group

texts.fr:
Mme SANATA est responsable du groupe TENDRE LA MAIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 03 vont à l’école et  elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation  depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Katreyaar. Ses clients sont les restauratrices.
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs de maïs pour transformer en farine.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité en ajoutant la vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe.
texts.en: Sanata is the leader of the "Tendre la main" group. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 23 years old and the youngest, 11. Three of her children go to school and she is also responsible for 3 more people. Sanata has been working in food production for 4 years. She gets her supplies at the Katreyaar market and her customers are women in the restaurant business. She would like to buy 3 bags of maize so that she can make flour with it. She wants to use her profits to strengthen her business. She aims to expand her business by adding the sale of charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of maize with which to make flour.

loans.name: Wendkouni Group

texts.fr:
Mme PERPETUE MARIE est responsable du groupe WENDKOUNI. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 05 vont à l’école. 
Mme est couturière  depuis 24ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Katreyaar. Ses clients sont les voisins et les gens environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter ½ rouleau de popeline, 01 rouleau de tissus et des boutons.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari dans la gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Perpetue Marie is the leader of the WENDKOUNI group. She is married with five children. The oldest is 27 and the youngest six years old. Five of them go to school.
This lady has been a seamstress for 24 years. She buys her stock at the market in Katreyaar. Her clients are neighbours and local people.
She wishes to buy half a roll of poplin and one roll of fabric and some buttons.
Mrs Perpetue Marie would like to use the profits to improve her business. She aims to help her husband with the management of their family.

loans.use: to buy half a roll of poplin, one roll of fabric and some buttons.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick es un joven que desea estudiar Publicidad, él esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Hola mi nombre es Erick, tengo 18 años, Oriundo de Santo domingo República Dominicana. Vivo con mis padres Y mis 2 hermanos.  Nací en un lugar muy humilde y lleno de necesidades para lo que se me ha dificultado ingresar a la universidad. Lamentablemente el sueldo de mis padres no alcanza para poder concretizar mi  sueño que es convertirme en un profesional donde solo apenas nos da para  obtener lo de diario vivir y más al tener a mis  hermanos bajo esta condiciones empeora aun la situación.
Mis sueños es estudiar Publicidad en la Universidad Apec ya que tengo la aptitud necesaria para esta carrera , mis padres ganan el sueldo mínimo por lo que no pueden costearme mis estudios , entonces me entere del proyecto Kiva-Fundapec y se abrió una esperanza para mí de poder logar eso que tanto sueno ser  un profesional y poder aportar a la sociedad mis conocimientos y un mejor  ayudar más adelante así como ustedes me ayudaran a mí a miles de jóvenes que como yo no tienen los recursos necesarios para poder estudiar.
Contar con este apoyo seria un alivio para mí y sobre todos mis padres que no tienen para que ninguno de sus hijos puedan estudiar, de obtener este soporte económico podría aportar demasiado a mi familia que lo necesita en este momento  con mis hermanos y poder ser útil para la sociedad
texts.en: Erick is a young man who wants to study advertising. He is asking for a loan to be able to pay for his education. This is his story: Hello, my name is Erick. I am 18 years old. I am from Santo Domingo, Domincan Republic. I live with my parents and my 2 siblings. I was born in a very humble place with a lot of needs, and that has made my going to college difficult. Unfortunately, my parents' wages aren't enough to make my dream come true, which is to get a college degree. There is barely enough to pay for daily expenses and having my siblings in this situation worsens the situation. My dream is to study Advertising at Universidad Apec, since I have aptitude for this major. My parents make minimum wage and can't pay for my education. Then I found out about the Kiva-Fundapec program and there was hope for me to achieve what I dream of so much and get a college degree and contribute my knowledge to society and help others the way you all all helping me and thousand of young people who don't have the resources to be able to go to school. Having this support will be a relief for me and above all for my parents, who don't have the money for any of their children to goo to school. With this financial support, I can contribute to my family what they need right now for my siblings and be useful to society.

loans.use: to pay for college registration.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven is a 51-year-old woman, living in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She is in a common-law relationship to her husband, and they are in business together, farming rice for their daily sustenance. She learned farm work from her parents, from the time she was a little girl. Thanks to them and her experience, she is able to earn income to support her nuclear family, which is comprised of 10 members.

At the moment, her home has no bathroom. So she is requesting a loan to build a bathroom, to fulfill her family’s hygiene need. This loan will improve her general living conditions, promote the family's health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is grateful for the loan that has been granted by HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than is usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, to fulfill her family’s hygiene need.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 25 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive solo en su casa propia. Carlos se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad, posee un mototaxi propio que también pudo obtener como resultado del ahorro por los trabajos eventuales que realizaba y aunque su vehículo no es nuevo le ha permitido salir de apuros económicos. A diario conduce por las calles de la ciudad en busca de los pasajeros a quienes transporta de un lugar a otro con la tranquilidad, serenidad y seguridad que requiere esta función, motivo por el cual asegura que sus clientes siempre se despiden con un gran gesto y palabras de gratitud. Realiza este trabajo desde hace 2 años y en este corto tiempo ha sabido enfrentar todo tipo de situaciones. Le agrada mucho su actividad pues tiene la ventaja de movilizarse al lugar que desee y organizar su propio horario trabajo. Le gustaría continuar trabajando y comprar otro vehículo para brindarle la oportunidad de trabajo a otra persona que requiera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, por tanto agradece a quienes financian su crédito y le dan el apoyo necesario para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará 3 llantas para refaccionar su mototaxi ya que con el mal estado de las pistas y el paso del tiempo se deterioraron, también tapizará su vehículo y pagó al mecánico.
texts.en: Carlos is 25 years old, single and has no children.  He lives on his own in his own house.  Carlos makes a living carrying cargo and passengers in and around the city.  Carlos has his own mototaxi, which he was able to buy as a result of savings he made from other work.  Although his vehicle is not new, it has allowed Carlos to get out of financial difficulties.  Every day Carlos works on the city streets looking for passengers to transport from A to B quietly, peacefully and safely.  As a result of this service, Carlos' customers always say goodbye with a grand gesture and grateful thanks.  Carlos has been doing this work for two years and, in this short time, has dealt with all types of situations.  Carlos is grateful for his work as he has the advantage of being able to go wherever he wants and he can decide his own timetable.  Carlos would like to continue working and to buy another vehicle in order to give somebody else who needs to improve their financial situation the opportunity to work.  On this occasion Carlos is applying for 1500 Nuevo Soles and is grateful to those financing the loan and giving him the necessary support to work toward his goals. Carlos will use this loan to buy three tyres as the current ones have become damaged by the bad state of the roads and have become deteriorated over time.  He will also upholster the vehicle and pay his mechanic.

loans.use: to buy three tyres, upholstery for his vehicle and to pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Héfumé

texts.fr: Veuve de 48ans, madame Héfumé est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 15 et 12ans qui sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré en 2009 la vente des produits d'alimentation générale. Confrontée par moment à la concurrence, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Madame Héfumé espère ouvrir une seconde boutique et avoir une bonne condition de vie avec ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Héfumé, age 48, is a widowed mother to two children aged 12 and 15 who both go to school. To support her family, she started to sell general food products in 2009. 

Facing competition, she is seeking a second loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. 

Mrs. Héfumé would like someday to open a second store, and she wants to ensure good living conditions for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy general food products for her store.

loans.name: Clément

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter d'acheter de la machine servant à peindre les voitures, mr Clément âgée de 34ans fait son premier crédit à WAGES. Il est peintre auto et est aidé par 01 personne dans son activité. Il désire avec ce profit ouvrir une autre garage et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille(Il est marié et père de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés). Notons qu'il a démarré l'activité en 1997.
texts.en: Mr. Clément is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy an apparatus for painting cars. Mr. Clément, age 34, is an automobile painter who works with one helper. He started this activity in 1997. He plans to use his profits to open another garage and to provide for his family. He is the married father of three children, two of whom go to school.

loans.use: to buy a compression device for painting cars.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is married with two sons. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Her husband works as a private company driver, while she is engaged with her buying and selling business of barbecue sticks to earn a living. She owns a motorcycle-rental service, and during weekends, her husband personally serves transportation services in their locality. The family gains an extra income from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC and is now requesting a new loan to cover the costs of motorcycle repairs and maintenance. Her dream is to see her children finish their education, and with their hope and determination, success is at hand.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 48 years old and married with four children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, bread, canned goods and other groceries.

Consolacion has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from prepaid mobile load phone credits.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan for her businesses.

Consolacion aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, bread, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 36-year-old, hardworking woman who has five children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling tomatoes. With the profits of this business, she has been able to build rental houses, from which she earns a monthly income. She faces challenges of price fluctuations and tenants who fail to pay on time. Nonetheless, she has a vision of owning a housing estate and a food store. Annet intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Darius is a tailor by training, and this is his business that gives him income. He is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He has been in the tailoring business for the last five years, and he started the business from the contributions of the family members. He knew Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy 20 pieces of sewing material, eight rolls of cloth lining and 70 rolls of threads. 

In the next five years, he hopes to pay school fees for his children through secondary school. The challenges that he faces in the business include high transportation costs, seasonal weather and taxation.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of sewing material, eight rolls of cloth lining and 70 rolls of threads.

loans.name: Sarith's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sarith is 50 years old and a mother of three kids. Nowadays, only one kid relies on her as this daughter is still in school. To strive for a living for the entire household, she does rice cropping on 1.5 hectares and plants rubber trees. Her current business, which she has been with for 15 years, has returned her about 22,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Sarith is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely, which has uplifted her living conditions better than before. For this loan cycle, in a group of two, she is a leader; she and her joint member are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. For Sarith, her entire loan portion will be spent on purchasing rubber tree seedlings. She hopes that this purchase will help to expand her rubber plantation on time and get a good yield so she can renovate her house into a good condition.

loans.use: to buy rubber tree seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Et's Group

texts.en: Et is a young mother of one little kid residing in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 22-year-old farmer who does rice farming on one hectare of land and cassava farming on a half hectare. This business, which her husband supports with his manpower, returns her about 12,000 KHR per day. Et is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group consisting of three female members. Et will spend her loan portion of 500,000 KHR on potash for her cassava. She hopes to plant her crop in a timely manner and produce a good yield so she can make more money and invest in rubber trees to further increase her income.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rot's Group

texts.en: A mother in her early 30s of three children who are in school, Rot is a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province where she does her agribusiness. For her entire family, one hectare of rice farming and half a hectare of cassava planting are her main source of income whereas working for others for a fee is the supplementary income. From the current business, she manages to earn up to 10,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Rot’s group consisting of two borrowers requesting 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to boost her rice and cassava crops and get back double yield with a good selling price so she can build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en: Arminda is applying for a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She is married, and she has six children. She is running a business in her house by selling dresses, short dresses, shirt sleeves, pants and shorts. She is making a good income from her selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her second-hand business in 2008 with her working capital of $600, and she is happy with this loan offered to her for improving for her living conditions and for the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy dresses, short dresses, shirt sleeves, pants and shorts.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Cristina es una mujer casada de 53 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa y tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el segundo grado de primaria ya que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para apoyarla y no había suficientes centros educativos cerca de su localidad para que ella pudiese estudiar. Tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo tres viven en la misma comunidad pero solo dos dependen de ella (Menores) uno de ellos estudio hasta ciclo común por la falta de recursos y la menor que tiene 17 años que está estudiando una carrera a distancia. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en las actividades del campo ya que en compañía de su esposo siendo ellos los únicos que se involucran hacen un gran esfuerzo para mantener limpias sus plantaciones de café. Ellos también cultivan maíz y frijol y sus tierras están ubicadas aproximadamente a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección del grano se involucran todos los miembros de su familia. Las personas que le compran su producto están ubicadas en una comunidad cercana y se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL el cual le ayudara a adquirir suministros que necesita para mejorar la producción de su negocio como: abono, fertilizantes entre otros ya que le ayudara a lograr obtener una mejor calidad en sus productos y así tener una mejor venta y por ende más ingresos a su familia.

Doña cristina tiene como meta lograr que su hija cumpla su sueño de graduarse en la universidad y además lograr agrandar su negocio para forjar un mejor patrimonio para dejarle una herencia digna a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and married.  She is a mother to five children and works in farming as well as being a housewife.  Cristina completed only up to the end of second grade in primary school as her parents did not have the money to support her and there were not enough schools near her town.  Of Cristina's five children, only three still live in the same community and only two are still dependent on their parents.  One of the children only studied up to the end of school and the youngest, 17-years-old, is studying an open learning degree course.  Cristina has a lot of experience working in the field as, alongside her husband, she puts in a lot of effort to keep her coffee crops clean.  In addition the couple grows corn and beans.  Their land is about five minutes from their home.  Come harvest all the family helps to cut and collect the coffee.  Cristina's products are purchased by people from a nearby community.  These people work exclusively buying and selling coffee.

Cristina is applying for a loan from "Comixmul" as it will help her to buy the necessary supplies to improve her business.  These supplies include manure and fertiliser and will give Cristina high quality products and she will have better sales and, consequently, a higher income for her family.

Cristina's goal is to see her daughter achieve her dream of graduating from university.  Cristina also wants to expand her business in order to have a decent inheritance to leave to her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for coffee crops.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been rendering his taxi service to local people by renting an automobile from a taxi service company since 2002. Before operating his taxi service, he had worked in South Korea through an employment contract between 1994 and 2001. His elder son works as an operator at a building company. The rent fee for automobiles he uses for his taxi service has increased and it became hard to live on he and his son's salary. So he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. He thinks it is far better in the long run to buy his own vehicle instead of renting an automobile.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Djeneba  est âgée de 49 ans, divorcée  et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit chez elle même  dans une famille nucléaire au   quartier Médine  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire à la douane de Ségou, parallèlement à cette activité. elle mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de jus, qu’elle  pratique depuis plus de 30 ans. 
Pour faire son jus elle utilise 10 kilos de sucre, 1kilo de gingembre, 0,5 kilo  de Tamarin, 10 sachets de sucre vanille et 5 sachets de poudres de jus (banane,  mangue, citron et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans une certaine quantité d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché,  le breuvage est ensuite mis  dans des bidons soigneusement lavés et qui seront dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement
Dans l’intention d’avoir un nouveau congélateur, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48 mois, après  4  prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter 1 congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.
Djeneba vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…) et de recruter 1 nouvel employé.
texts.en:
Djeneba is 49 years old, divorced, and the mother of two. She lives in her own place in a nuclear family in the Médine district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A secretary at the Ségou customs department, she also runs revenue-generating businesses, especially the sale of juice drinks, which she has been doing for over thirty years. 

To make her juice drinks, she uses 10 kg of sugar, 1 kg of ginger, ½ kg of tamarind, 10 pouches of vanilla sugar, and 5 pouches of powdered drink (banana, mango, lime, and orange). All of it is mixed in a certain amount of water for obtaining the desired taste. The beverage is then placed into carefully washed containers, which will be placed into the refrigerator to cool. 

Wanting to obtain a new freezer, so as to make more profit, Djeneba turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had ties to it for 48 months and has paid back four individual loans. She is on her fifth individual loan, which she intends to use to purchase a freezer. She gets her supplies in Bamako. 

Accepting cash or credit, Djeneba makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to support herself and to take part in societal events (baptisms, marriages, etc…) and to recruit a new employee.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for her business selling juice drinks

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a mat weaver from Bohol, Philippines. Virginia is a married woman and has 8 children. Virginia has been in the mat weaving business for more than 10 years now. Mat weaving is a lucrative business in the area.
As of now, Virginia needs additional capital for her mat weaving business. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like "romblon" or native palm, dye or coloring agents. Through this loan, she will be able to weave and sell more mats, thus increasing her sales and profit. Virginia dreams of an improved livelihood and continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, dye or coloring agents

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a patient mother of six children. She works selling barbecue in her village. 

Margie is requesting a loan to buy barbecue sticks, meat, chicken legs and heads, spices, and more street food to offer. She hopes that her loan will let her increase the food products she can offer at her stall. Margie believes her loan will be very helpful in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy barbecue sticks, meat, and spices for her food business

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et agrandir son activité, Kokoé sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des ingrédients(riz, ignames et mais) entrant dans la préparation de la nourriture. Elle  est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en: To improve her family's living conditions and to expand her business, Kokoé is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase ingredients (rice, yams, and corn) for making food to sell [in her restaurant]. She is married and a mother of four children.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame  Fanta est âgée de 52 ans, mariée  et mère de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une famille nucléaire au  quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école,   elle commença très tôt  à mener des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et ustensiles de cuisine. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle évolua seule pour faire le commerce d’habits. Elle exerce seule cette activité depuis 21 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. Sa force de vente est la qualité de ses habits qui sont de premier choix.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle surtout en ces périodes de vacances scolaires où les parents achètent pour leurs enfants afin de les préparer pour la rentrée prochaine.
 Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois, après avoir fait 3 prêts solidaires et 6 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 7ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter 5 balles de friperies,  elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et des fois sur place.
Madame Fanta vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de renforcer son fonds de commerce, de payer ses charges locatives ainsi que de faire face à son échéance de prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Ms. Fanta is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the Darsalam district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school, Ms. Fanta started running revenue-generating businesses early on, along with her mother, who used to sell condiments and kitchen utensils. After several years of apprenticeship at her mother's side, she worked by herself doing commerce in clothing. She has been working by herself in this business for 21 years and enjoys a great reputation and fame. Her selling power is due to the quality of her clothing, which are first picks. 

With plans to increase her business capital in order to cope with the customer demand, especially during the school-year vacation, when parents make purchases for their children to prepare for the return to school, [Ms. Fanta is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso]. She has had ties to it for sixty months after having had three solidarity loans and six individual loans, all paid back. She is now on her seventh individual loan, which she will use to purchase 5 bales of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies from Bamako and sometimes locally.

She accepts cash or credit from a mixed customer base. She envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA enabling her to bolster her working capital and to pay for her transportation costs, as well as to cope with the Soro Yiriwaso loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Mr Kossi vit avec sa conjointe(couturière) et leurs 04 enfants tous à LOME. En 2012, il a crée son propre école et donne le meilleur de lui même dans l’enseignement. le deuxième prêt pris à WAGES l'aidera à rénover son école afin d’accueillir plus d’élèves en cette rentrée scolaire. Il espère créer écoles et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi lives in Lomé with his spouse, a seamstress, and their four children. In 2012, he started his own school and has been dedicating the best of himself to teaching. 

This second loan from WAGES will help him to renovate the school to accommodate more children at the start of the school year. 

His goal is to open more schools, and he wants to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his school.

loans.name: Antonet

texts.en:
Antonet is 23 years old and married with two children.

Antonet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like bread, diapers, sugar, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

Antonet has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing and e-loading (prepaid mobile load).

Antonet aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, diapers, sugar, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Helda

texts.en:
Helda is a married woman with no children. For the past five years, she has operated a beauty salon and her potential customers are women. Helda lives in a rental house with both running water and electricity and her major expenses are food and rent. Helda decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

Helda is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to purchase chemicals, hair braids, hair weaves, and conditioners for her salon. In the future, she dreams of earning more income and building her own house.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, hair braids, hair weaves, and conditioners for her salon

loans.name: Carmen Juana

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la ciudad de Carhuaz, es madre de un pequeño niño de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y por quien trabaja cada día con mucho esfuerzo. Luego de mucho ahorro y sacrificio logro tener su negocio de venta de limones, ella ofrece sus productos en el mercado de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 cliente en el día.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (limones al por mayor) con lo cual podrá abastecerlo y poder atender a sus clientes de mejor manera, así mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder brindarle una buena educación y calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the city of Carhuaz and is mother to a young two-year-old son, whom she loves a lot and for whom she works very hard every day.  After a lot of saving and sacrifice Carmen managed to start her own business selling lemons.  She sells her products in the city market and works some nine hours a day, selling to up to twenty customers a day.

Carmen is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy more merchandise (lemons, which she will buy in bulk) for her business.  She will then be able to stock up her business and better serve her customers.  She will then be able to increase her income and will continue fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: to have her own house and provide a good upbringing and quality of life to her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Noern

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Noern is a 34-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Cassava and rice farming have been the only source for her family’s income to make a living for the last 13 years. She and her husband also work as laborers.The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day. 
Noern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully paid back the loan. Now she is requesting for another loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en:
Houy, 44, is widowed and lives with her three children in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Two of her three children are still in school. She has been growing cassava for 26 years. Her family’s daily income is about 33,000 KHR per day but she can manage to save about 11,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Houy’s group consists of two women. She is a first cycle client. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Houy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay laborers. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
Soun is 50 years old and has six children. She lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province and her main source of income is from rice cropping. Soun has been a rice farmer for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Soun is the leader of a six-borrower loan group with VisionFund that is requesting a 5,500,000 KHR loan. This is the group’s first loan. Soun will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and potash for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and increase her income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and potash for her crop

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La is 40 years old and single. She lives in a village of the Prey Chhor district. For the past 11 years, La has grown cassava and farmed rice to make a living. She also works for others for a fee. La manages to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children. 

La is the leader of a group loan with VisionFund. This will be her second loan and she completely repaid her previous loan which enabled her improve her family’s living conditions. La will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will also use a portion of it for labor fees. She hopes her loan will enable her to earn more income so as to fulfill her dream of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour, 33, is married and lives with his family in a village of the Ponhea Luer district. He has four children to take care of and they are still in school. 

To make a living, Hour has been working as a teacher and also farming rice. Engaging in this business for 26 years, he is able to earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s need.

Hour has joined VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, for this cycle as a second-time borrower. He is now applying for a loan to pay for his son’s university tuition. He hopes this loan will enable him to continue his son’s education until graduation and also that it will help to relieve his family's financial burden, so he can sustain and grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a single woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.

For over four years, she has had a juice-making business, using fruits and sugar to make juice, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000 loan, Aida wants to purchase sugar and fruits to make her juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and fruits to make her juice to sell.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
José cuenta con 49 años de edad, se dedica a la Agricultura desde los ocho años de edad, sus estudios solo fue hasta segundo año de primaria. En la actualidad está acompañado, tiene tres hijos.
Compra los productos en la ciudad a unos 12 kilómetros de la comunidad, para ello debe buscar un vehículo privado para que le realice el viaje a comprar sus productos es así que hace llegar a su casa los productos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  comprar 6 sacos de abono, para fertilizar 14,000 metros cuadrados de sandia y 14,000 metros cuadrados de ajonjolí.  A demás, pagara la preparación de la tierra hasta tenerla de punto de siembra tomando en cuenta que la mano de obra no calificada es parte de ellos como familia.
Con el préstamo estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de comprar sus insumos y estar seguro que le dará el cuido necesario a su s cultivos su fertilización a tiempo adecuado.
En el futuro planea hacerse de una casa digna, segura donde sus hijos tengan privacidad todos es tan grandes y los dormitorios no tienen divisiones. Su gran sueño es eso y que por lo menos el último de sus hijos que  está estudiando que no deje de estudiar que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is forty-nine years old. He has worked in agriculture since he was eight. He attended school only until the second grade of primary school. He now has a partner and three children. 

He purchases products in a city about twelve kilometres from his community. To do so he must hire a private vehicle to make the trip so he can buy and return home with the products. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy six bags of manure to fertilize 14,000 square meters of watermelon and 14,000 square meters of sesame. He will also pay for the land to be prepared for sowing, keeping in mind that the unskilled labour is like family. 

With the loan he will fulfil the need to buy supplies and will be able to give the necessary care and fertilization to his crops at the proper time. 

In the future he plans to build a decent and safe home where his children have privacy. They are all older and the bedrooms do not have divisions. This is his dream. He also wants his youngest son who is in school to continue studying and to have a career.

loans.use: to buy six bags of manure to fertilize 14,000 square meters of watermelon and 14,000 square meters of sesame. He will also pay for the land to be prepared for sowing, keeping in mind that the unskilled labour is like family.

loans.name: Nansa

texts.fr:
Madame NANSA est âgée de 56 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et les enfants de sa coépouse décédée, au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, (analphabétisme des parents) elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits. Après  15 ans d’activités à  ses coté  et riche de cette expérience, elle évolua seule pour mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente d’habits, de chaussures, de draps de lit et la préparation vente  de jus de fruits. Elle mène cette dernière activité depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle, sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son jus, bien dosé et soigneusement mis  dans des emballages propres et portant son nom. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle est rentrée en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois, après 2 prêts individuels tous remboursés correctement. Elle est  à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 sacs de sucre et 5 cartons de poudre de jus. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte et de tout âge. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt, à s’occuper d’elle même ainsi qu’aux enfants de coépouse défunte. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une alimentation générale dans son quartier.
texts.en:
Mrs. NANSA, age 56, is married with five children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her children, and the children of a deceased co-wife in the district of Bagadadji in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Nansa never attended school due to social reasons (her parents were illiterate). Therefore, she learned the trade of commerce alongside her mother who was selling clothing. After 15 years of activity together, and enriched by this experience, Nansa started her own income-generating activities such as the sale of clothing, shoes, and bed sheets, as well as the preparation and sale of fruit juices, an activity she has been practicing for 15 years and for which she enjoys a large customer base. Her sales strength resides in the quality of her juice, which she prepares carefully and sells in clean containers bearing her name. 

To bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago, and has already obtained and repaid 2 individual loans. This is her 3rd loan cycle with the MFI, and she plans to use the credit to buy 5 bags of sugar and 5 cartons of powdered juice. She buys her stock locally and sells her product for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele of all ages. 

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that she will use to repay her loan, to support herself and to take care of her late co-wife’s children. 

Her goal is to open a general food store in the area.

loans.use: to buy the supplies needed to make juice for sale.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина является мастером своего дела. Ей 23 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей.  Зарина опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. У нее был неблагополучный брак, и поэтому она развелась с мужем и данное время живет с родителями. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад она начала свой бизнес. Она имеет швейный цех, который находится на местном рынке. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее клиенты довольны ее услугой. Она также шьёт и дома. Она должна отремонтировать свои швейные машинки, а также купить кондиционер и холодильник для домохозяйства, так как летом им очень трудно хранить продукты питания. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarina  excels at her trade. She is 23 years old. She is divorced, without children. Zarina is an experienced seamstress and sews  traditional Tajik outfits that are true masterpieces. She had an unhappy marriage, which is why she got a divorce and currently lives with her parents. In order to provide for her family's needs, four years ago she launched her own business. She owns a sewing shop, located at the local market. Thanks to the quality of her services, she has built a wide customer base. Her customers are satisfied with her services. She also sews at home. She needs to repair her sewing machines and also buy an air conditioner and a refrigerator for the household, since in the summer it is very hard to preserve food. She is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy air an conditioner and fridge for her household and  repair sewing machines for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a farmer living in the town of Ubay on the island of Bohol in the Philippines. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for two years now. Rhea helps her husband in tilling and in overseeing their farm, which is their main source of income.

Rhea needs a loan of 5000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Rhea and her husband will be able to improve their land's productivity.

In the future, Rhea hopes to expand the farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary to sustain the family's basic needs and for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, a 35-year-old married mother of two, provides a motorcycle transport service to her local community members. Engaged in the business for more than two years, she usually earns about  PHP 300 in net income daily. 

Marites is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase oil, a sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that she will get the amount requested to better meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket and gasoline for the maintenance of her transport motorcycle

loans.name: Kpatcha

texts.fr: Mr Kpatcha est marié et père de famille. Il est cultivateur de profession et exerce son activité en RÉGION CENTRALE. Il cultive du soja, du mais, du piment et des tomates depuis 1990 et s'y plait bien car cela lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant d'assurer les besoins primaires de la famille. Il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des outils de travail afin d'avoir un rendement encore considérable. Il espère à l'avenir, investir dans le reboisement et assurer un avenir meilleur à la famille. Il est âgé de 39ans.
texts.en: Mr. Kpatcha is married and has children. He is a farmer by trade and works in the Central Region of Togo. He has been growing soya, corn, pimento and tomatoes since 1990. He likes this work as it allows him to provide for his family’s basic needs. He is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to buy work tools in order to increase his harvest. In the future he hopes to invest in a replanting and provide a better future for his family. He is 39 years old.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store and rice retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en: Sang, age 52, is a married mother of one independent son originally from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province.  She struggles to cover her daily cost of living via five hectares of rice farming. She is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day from the current business which she has had for ages. Sang, a second time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) is leading six other borrowers who are first time borrowers to get a new loan. Her first loan has helped her to grow her crop on time and gain her a good yield. For this new cycle, the total amount of her entire group is 5,200,000 KHR of which 700,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for farmland-leasing fee. She highly believes that she can gain a good income to keep uplifting her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for farmland-leasing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is single and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks for her store, such as sugar, salt, milk, coffee, body loosen, fish, noodles, eggs, cigarettes and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Filomena is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her store such as sugar, salt, milk, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Household consumables are her greatest monthly expense.

For the past ten years, Mwanamisi has operated a khanga (women's clothing) business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs, but dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, Mwanamisi wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's clothes) for resale

loans.name: Hermi Libardo

texts.es:
Hermi es un señor con sueños  grandes los cuales eran terminar sus estudios  y convertirse   en un gran cocinero pero por  cuestiones del conflicto armado se acabaron  sus sueños, cuando este señor  se encontraba terminando  sus estudios  fue desplazado  por la guerrilla del retorno a su pueblo en el  2003.
Pero cierto día Hermi  llego a otro pueblo y comenzó  a sobrevivir  en las calles  luego el gobierno le dio la oportunidad de trabajar,  luego se regresó a la cuidada   y empezó a soñar nuevamente, entonces quiso seguir estudiando y trabajando  para pagar sus estudios pero el sueño de este señor es llegar a convertirse en un chef  y poder salir adelante sin importar  los problemas y las dificultades
texts.en:
Hermi's a man with big dreams, which were to finish school and become a great chef.  His dreams ended because of the armed conflict, however.  When he was finishing his studies he was displaced by the guerrilla war in his community in 2003.

One day Hermi arrived in another town and began to survive on the streets.  Then the government gave him the opportunity to work.  Later he returned to the city and started to dream again.  He wanted to continue to study and work so he could pay for his education.

Hermi's dream is to become a chef and be able to get ahead without worrying about problems and difficulties.

loans.use: to study in CampoAlto

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
Emelina tiene 33 años de edad está acompañada y es madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación de primaria completo, sin embargo sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y en compañía de su compañeros de hogar se dedican a la agricultura. Sus hijos el mayor tiene 9 años y está cursando el cuarto año de educación primaria, la segunda hija tiene 5 años y está cursando el pre-escolar en misma comunidad y el ultimo tiene dos años. Su principal y única actividad como medio de ingreso económico para su familia es el cultivo y siembra de café, maíz y frijoles. Ella apoya a su esposo hasta la corta y traslado del mismo ya que se tiene que encargar de los quehaceres del hogar. La tierra productora es propia y está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección del grano se involucran ellos dos ya que sus hijos están muy pequeños para poder brindarles el apoyo que necesitan. EL grano lo vende a intermediarios que se dedican a la compra-venta de café.

Emelina ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como chapola (plantitas de café), también comprara abono y otra parte la destinara para la preparación de tierra donde será sembrada la nueva plantilla. 

Sus metas son las de poder alcanzar al final de la cosecha lo esperado, seguir agrandando sus cultivos y formar un buen patrimonio para sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es poder graduar a sus 3 hijos de la universidad para que a futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos y ver sus logros en ellos ya que no pudieron culminar sus estudios por falta de recursos.
texts.en:
Emelina is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She completed her primary education, but her parents also taught her how to work the land, which is how she and her family earn a living. Her oldest child is nine years old and he is studying his fourth year of primary education. Her middle child is five years old, and she is in preschool in the same community. Her youngest child, a boy, is two years old. Emelina’s principal and only source of income for her family is growing coffee, corn and beans. She helps her husband with the crops, while also looking after the household work. They own the fields where they grow their crops, and these are located near their home. Emelina and her husband harvest and gather the crops, as their children are still too young to be able to help them. They sell their coffee beans to intermediaries who buy and sell coffee.

Emelina is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as coffee seedlings and fertilizer. She will also use part of the loan to prepare the fields where they will plant the coffee seedlings.

Emelina’s goal is to achieve the harvest she is hoping for, and to continue increasing the amount of land she has under cultivation so that her children will have a good inheritance. Her greatest wish is to see her three children graduate from university, so that in the future they can look after themselves. She would like to see the achievements of her children, because she and her husband were unable to finish their studies due to a lack of resources.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and fertilizer, and to prepare the land for growing coffee.

loans.name: Cristina  Yineth

texts.es:
Cristina era una niña que desde pequeña quería estudiar medicina su sueño era ser una doctora buena en su trabajo quería especializarse en pediatría ya que siempre le han gustados los niños con el pasar del tiempo cristina quiso ser muchas cosas psicóloga, profesora, abogada, y hasta azafata quería ser pero a pesar de esas carreras nunca olvido su sueño de ser médico.
En su último año de bachillerato cristina no sabía que hacer ya que dentro de poco saldría de aquella época de amigos diversión y travesuras  que tanto disfrutaba para salir al mundo real donde hay que luchar para lograr cosas mejores, después de su grado cristina empezó averiguar sobre los estudios que quería realizar pero ya en esa época se le había olvidado su sueño ya que mucha gente le decía que para esa carrera se necesitaba mucho más que la simple voluntad.

Con esa simples palabras cristina abandono su sueño y empezó a buscar las otras carreras que quería estudiar un día hablando con su hermano él le pregunto que había pasado con su sueño ya que el recordaba que desde pequeña cristina jugaba a la doctora con sus muñecos, ella respondió que por cosas de la vida ósea dinero no puedo estudiar eso aunque hubiera dado todo para estudiar medicina.

El hermano de cristina le dijo que no abandonara su sueño que estudiara auxiliar en enfermería ya que así podía ir subiendo cristina lo pensó y le dio la razón así que empezó a estudiar auxiliar en enfermería  ya lleva un semestre y le encanta ella sabe que al salir a trabajar en un hospital como auxiliar se puede pagar la enfermería superior y al acabar con esa puede pagarse su carrera de medicina y especializarse en pediatría.

Lo que más le gusta a cristina de enfermería es aprender a suministrar medicamentos, canalizar,  sacar sangre, curar heridas,  y demás ella sabe lo que una auxiliar tienen que hacer pero no le da asco ni nada porque ella sabe que al pasar por todo eso puede llegar a ser una gran doctora .
Esta es la historia de cristina una adolecente que desde niña quería ser doctora y que poco a poco y con esfuerzo y dedicación lograr aquel sueño de ser la mejor médico pediatra y sacar adelante a su familiar y hacer que se sientan orgullosos de ella
texts.en:
Cristina was a child who from an early age wished to study medicine. Her dream was to be a doctor who was good at her work. She wanted to specialize in pediatrics since she has always liked children. With the passage of time, Cristina wanted to be many things: psychologist, professor, lawyer, and even a flight attendant. But despite all these career choices, she never forgot her dream of being a doctor.

In the final year of her baccalaureate, Cristina couldn't decide what to do since shortly, she would leave that epoch of friends, diversions, and daring which she enjoyed so much to enter the real world where one has to struggle to achieve better things. After graduating, Cristina began to think about what she should study but in this period, she had forgotten her dream, because many people told her that for this career she needed more than simply the will.

With these simple words, Cristina abandoned her dream and began looking for other careers to study. One day she spoke with her brother and he asked her what had become of her dream, since he recalled that from an early age, Cristina had played at being a doctor with her dolls. She responded that due to life's conditions, that is money, she couldn't study medicine, although she would have given everything to do so.

Cristina's brother said that Cristina shouldn't abandon her dream entirely, that she should study to be a nursing assistant. She accepted the idea and began to study to be a nursing assistant. After a semester she was excited to begin working in a hospital as an assistant, enabling her to pay to enroll in the superior nursing program and upon finishing this, she could better afford her career in medicine and specialize in pediatrics.

What Cristina likes most about nursing is learning to administer medicines, channel her assistance, take blood, cure wounds, and other things she has learned that an assistant must do. None of these tasks cause her revulsion because she knows that by doing all this, she will become a grand doctor.

This is the story of Cristina, an adolescent who from her childhood, wished to be a doctor and who little by little and with effort and dedication, is achieving the dream of becoming the best pediatric doctor, and of advancing her family and making them proud of her.

loans.use: to study towards her pediatric medical degree.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa tiene 59 Años de edad es agricultora y madre de familia la cual está compuesta por 11 hijos con un grado de educación cursado hasta el sexto grado ya que sus padres no tenían la capacidad para darle la oportunidad para que estudiara hasta la universidad y era muy difícil el hecho de estudiar ya que no habían los suficientes centros de educación para poder asistir. De sus 11 hijos solo 5 viven con ella, una está estudiando psicología en la universidad, dos solo sacaron el ciclo común y se dedican a apoyarle a sus padres en los trabajos del campo, y las dos menores que está en último año de la secundaria. Su fuente de ingreso económico es el cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres y luego continúo con su esposo. Ya recolectado el grano y listo para su venta este es comprado por intermediarios que se dedican a la compra-venta de café quienes venden el producto en otras localidad.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que le permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas como: 8 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 8 QQ formula 18-26-0 entre otros que aran de sus cultivos productivos y atractivos para sus clientes.

Doña Teresa quiere a futuro mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para lograr hacer un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos además lograr dejarles una tierra fortalecida y digna para que ellos el día de mañana puedan enfrentar los problemas financieros entre otros de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa is 59 years old and is a farmer. She is a mother of a family of 11 children and she attended school up to the sixth grade. She was not able to go any further in school because her parents didn't have the resources to send her to university and it would have been very difficult to continue in school anyway because there were not enough schools located near enough to attend. Of her 11 children, 5 still live with her, one is studying psychology at university, two one finished required schooling and they stay at home to help their parents in the fields and the two youngest are in their last year of secondary school. The source of their income is their cultivation of coffee, something that she learned from her parents and then continued with her spouse. They have already collected the seeds and they are ready to sell to the middle men who specialize in the buying and selling of coffee in their area. 

She is asking for a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL, which will help her to purchase fertilizer and various specialty products that she will use to plant more productive harvests and attract more clientele. 

Ms. Teresa wants to improve their business in the future and be able to give a better inheritance to their children, as well as give them a bit of land that they will be able to use in the future if they run into any financial problems.

loans.use: purchase supplies to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Los Luchadores Group

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene una hija, vive en  el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y café. Lleva 5 años cultivando una finca de café y este grano  es vendido en la zona donde vive. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo  por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar la finca de café para sacar buenas cosechas y mejorar su condición de vida, el cual es en forma grupal.
El grupo se llama Los Luchadores y esta formado por 11 personas, quienes han solicitado un préstamo total por 68,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y limpiar la finca de café. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. 
En al foto se identifican así. A la izquierda esta Ubaldo de gorra roja, sigue Miguel camisa beige, Víctor de gorra blanca, Israel de camisa roja, Félix con camisa celeste, Miguel Angel coordinador camisa amarilla, Rigoberto a la derecha de gorra beige, al frente esta a la izquierda Mártir, sigue María de blusa azul, Ermelinda de blusa roja, y María Aracely con falda a la derecha.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 30, is in a common-law marriage.  He and his wife have a daughter.  He lives in the Nueva Frontera municipality in Santa Bárbara.  He has always grown basic grains and coffee.  He has spent five years cultivating a coffee farm.  This grain is sold in the area where he lives.

He has decided to request a loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to fertilizer the coffee farm.  He will do this in order to get good harvests and to improve his living conditions.  This is a group loan.

The group is named Los Luchadores, and it is comprised of 11 people.  They have requested a loan for the total of 68,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to clear the fields on the coffee farm.  All of them are from the same community, and they are farmers.

In the photo, starting on the left, they are Ubaldo in a red hat, Miguel in a beige shirt, Víctor in a white hat, Israel in a red shirt, Félix in a sky blue shirt, Miguel Angel, the coordinator, in a yellow shirt, Rigoberto, on the right, in a beige hat.  From the front left is Mártir, then María in a blue blouse, Ermelinda in a red blouse, and María Aracely is on the right with a skirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to clear the fields on the coffee farm.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtaivan, 43 years old, lives with her two daughters, two sons-in-law and two grandchildren in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a shoe repair shop near the medical college for fifteen years. 

Her elder son-in-law just began working at a software company as a manager. She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric car for her son-in-law. The advantage of electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution from the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. 

The car will be used by her son-in-law for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 35 years old and is married with three children who are all currently in school. She lives in the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Monica has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells clothes. She is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans. 

Monica is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more garments to sell and help expand her business. She will use the profit from her loan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and provide for other family needs. Monica hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Lorreine

texts.es:
Lorreine de 49 años, esta casada con Estanis y tiene 4 hijos a quienes crió y educó hasta que se hicieron independientes y personas honorables, ahora ella vive al lado de su esposo en su casa propia. Lorreine se dedica a la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir. Trabaja en su casa en donde espera la llegada de sus vecinos, amigos o personas conocidas que tengan la necesidad de obtener alguna prenda exclusiva para una ocasión especial o que sencillamente requieran de alguna labor pequeña como enmendar alguna prenda descosida, colocar un botón en alguna camisa o pantalón. Lleva en este trabajo más de 10 años y lo hace con una máquina de coser antigua y vieja a la cual guarda mucho cariño por considerarla su fiel compañera de trabajo.
Asegura tener muchos clientes que siempre se quedan contentos al ver el trabajo final. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
