Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones y agujas.
texts.en:
Lorreine, 49, is married to Estanis.  She raised and educated four children until they were independent and honorable people.  Now she lives with her husband in her own house.

Lorreine earns a living making and mending clothing.  She works at home, waiting for her neighbors, friends, or acquaintances who need some exclusive garment for a special occasion or simply some small job like mending something that has come unstitched or putting a button on a shirt or pair of pants.

She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She uses an old sewing machine that she takes care of affectionately because she considers it to be her loyal coworker.  She says she has a lot of customers who are always happy when they see the final product.

Currently she'll request 500 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to know she has some financial support to guarantee she'll continue working in peace.  She promises to continue being a punctual member with her payments.

With the requested amount she'll buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, buttons, and needles.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Teodosia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras regionales como yuca, limones, plátano y otros productos tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado principal de la ciudad y lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y sus ganancias económicas le están sirviendo para educar y criar a sus hijos, siempre trabajó sola y lo hace así hasta ahora. Le va bien en su actividad ya que siempre se entrega al máximo para poder tener sus ingresos de manera sostenible ya que por el esfuerzo que le demanda tiene que trabajar buscando siempre su comodidad, su actividad le permite tener ganancias para así cumplir con las obligaciones económicas del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos productos regionales como plátano, yuca, limones y otros para continuar vendiendo en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children who live at home with her. Teodosia makes a living by selling regional fruits and vegetables like yucca, lemons, bananas, etc. She has a spot in the city's main market.

She has been working at this job for 10 years and her earnings are helping to educate and raise her children. She has always worked alone, and she continues to do so now. She is doing well in her business since she always dedicates herself to the fullest in order to have a sustainable income. Because this requires a lot of effort, she is always working to be comfortable.

Her business allows her to earn income that satisfies the economic requirements of her home. At this time, she requests 600 soles and thanks everyone who makes this loan possible so that she can continue to perform her job with better results. She also promises once again to make her payments on time.

With the requested loan, she will buy different regional products like bananas, yucca, lemons, etc. so that she can continue selling them at her place in the market.

loans.use: to buy regional products like bananas, yucca, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Los Andes Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS ANDES  está  compuesto por doce integrantes, once mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Maria en la foto la de chamarra azul, ella tiene 46 años y tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar más mercadería,  su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Maria  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Andes has twelve members, eleven women and one man. Its chairperson is Maria, who appears in the photo wearing a blue jacket. She is 46 years old and has three children who go to school. She works selling clothes according to the season, selling her products in her stall. 

This is her first loan with this institution, and Maria will use it to buy wholesale garments such as sweaters and jackets so that she can stock her business for the cold season. This season is characterized by a lot of sales and even orders. The reason why she is requesting this loan is that she lacks capital. Maria faces challenges to her business such as the daily competition. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise. 

Her wish is for her business to be well stocked so that she can offer her clients a variety of products. Maria is happy and grateful to the institution for its support, since it helps her to improve in her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale garments, such as jackets and sweaters

loans.name: Vergensita

texts.en:
Vergencita is married with an only child, and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. Her husband is operating their own “van” transportation and rental business while she sells beauty products in their community to make a living. 

For many years, the family is earning not less than 10,000 PHP a month from this business. 

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully paid her previous loans that contributed much to the running of their business. She has taken a new loan of 15,000 to purchase canned and bottled goods, noodles, and assorted foodstuffs to sell in her sari-sari store.  

She wants to see her child become successful, so without a doubt, she saves a portion from her generated revenue for her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase canned and bottled goods, noodles, and assorted foodstuffs to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school and are under her care. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She operates a business selling clothes at the market. Her customers are her neighbors and the residents of her town. Her major challenge is the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons in her place of work. 

With this loan, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Diego no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Diego trabaja como chofer de mototaxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Diego se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tramite de licencia de circulación y tarjeta de propiedad, de esta manera Diego podrá seguir circulando y brindando sus servicios sin problemas, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Diego is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and brothers.  He is a friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic young man with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, he was not able to study for the management career he wanted due to lack of resources.

Diego works as a moto-taxi driver, providing transport services in his town every day for about 10 hours a day and believes that things are going well for him because he knows the areas where he can find a large number of passengers.

Diego is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because he will be able to cover the cost of his driver’s license and registration.  In this way Diego will be able to continue driving and providing services with no problems.  He will continue to work and making an effort to achieve his greatest dream of having a great transportation services company.

loans.use: to register his vehicle.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 44 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Tomas pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Pintado de Vehículos.
Por iniciativa propia, Tomas trabaja en su pequeño taller de pintado de vehículos menores, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Tomas se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una motoaxi de segunda mano, ya que en las noches y los fines de semana desea brindar servicios de transporte en su ciudad, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran taller de pintado y tapizado de vehículos.
texts.en:
Tomas is 44 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucalla.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who puts forth all his efforts to get ahead.  Thanks to his efforts and his parents’ support, he was able to study for a career painting cars.

He works in a small vehicle paint shop every day for about 10 yours and believes that things are going well for him because of the friendly service he provides for others.

Tomas is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to them he will buy a second hand moto-taxi because he wants to provide transport services around the city in the evenings and on weekends.  He will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of having a vehicle painting and upholstery business.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Seneyda

texts.es: Doña Sorayda tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 5 años, negocio el cual ha mantenido estable junto al apoyo de su familia. Como otra fuente de ingreso posee el salario de su esposo que es de mucha ayuda para gastos del hogar. Su expectativa es superarse y obtener mayor clientela con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como: crema, maquillaje, perfumes, labial y una vitrina donde pueda exhibir sus productos con el fin de satisfacer al cliente. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Sorayda is 45 years old, is from Managua, is married, and has 4 children. She is a merchant and has sold cosmetics for the past 5 years. Her business has remained stable thanks to the support of her family. Her husband's salary is another source of income for the family, which helps a lot with the household expenses.

Her hope is to improve herself and obtain better clientele, which will hopefully increase her income. She requests the loan to buy merchandise like cream, makeup, perfume, lipstick, and a display case to show off her products, with the goal of satisfying her clients. Her plan for the future is to improve her house's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy cream, makeup, perfume, lipstick, and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Faith Mithini Group

texts.en:
Faith Mithini Group is a young group started by women living on a shared rental plot. Their aim is to embrace renewable energy that will help them improve their lives by saving money and time and improving their families' health. The five women are all teachers at a rural school, and they have been using a big portion of their salary to buy fuel. They use charcoal and LPG gas for cooking and also buy kerosene and candles for lighting, as their homes are not connected to the electricity grid.

Jane, the eldest among them, sitted at the middle in the photo, has lived in this village for the last 11 years and has suffered the effects of  using kerosene.  Three years ago one of her children accidentally hit a kerosene lantern, sending their house into flames and leaving them homeless. She was not aware that there was an alternative to kerosene, however, so she continued using it. Only recently did she meet the VEP sales team at a community training and learned about solar lamps, which caught her interest. She also  confesses that the poor lighting levels from kerosene lamps has for years made it difficult for her children and those of her neighbors to study, affecting their performance in school. With solar lighting she hopes this will change and they will get better grades.

These women are taking a loan to purchase a solar home package that will enable each of them to light up to four rooms, charge mobile phones, and use a small radio.  Together with her group mates they will spread the benefits of using solar and transform their dark village into a bright one.

loans.use: To purchase Solar lamps

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Rithy is 23 years old and married with one child. He and his wife earn a living by farming cassava and planting rubber as the main source of the family’s income; he works for others for a fee for additional income. Having been in this business for three years, they are able to earn about 21,900 KHR per day to meet their family’s needs. 

Rithy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. He is a second loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has completely repaid back the previous loan. He successfully used his first loan to support his family. 

Now he is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while another group member is applying for 600,000 KHR from VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. 

He hopes to earn more income to fulfill his dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan is 32 years old and the married mother of three dependent children, all of whom are still in school. For the past 15 years, she has been a rice farmer and she also works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Phan can earn about 35,600 KHR per day.

Phan is the leader of a two-member female loan group from the village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. This will be their second loan cycle with the Kiva partner, VisionFund and they are requesting a 500,000 PKR loan. Phan will use her portion of the loan to buy insecticide for her cassava farming and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her crop to expend her homeland and farmland.

loans.use: to buy insecticide for her cassava and to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is separated from his wife and has three children that he takes care of using his salary from a company where he works as an accountant. Using his savings, he has managed to buy land that he is developing by putting up a commercial building to increase his income. The building is at the foundation stage.

Emmanuel is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy building materials to complete his commercial building. He is a first-time loan recipient. In the future, Emmanuel would like to complete his building and generate more income and to be able to easily meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Rosa Nely

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad está acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café. Ella aprendió dichas actividades en compañía de su pareja y de sus padres ya que ellos han sido desde toda una vida agricultores. Tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. En la agricultura especialmente con el café es un producto delicado y de no tratarse a tiempo con los insumos necesario puede perderse la cosecha completa. 

Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual planea comprar 12 QQ de fertilizantes, 12 QQ de urea 10 QQ de formula cafetalera  entre otros con los cuales mantendrá segura y sana para la próxima cosecha.

Sus metas a largo plazo son las de ampliar sus cultivos de café con la compra de más tierra, sembrar una variedad de café más competitiva y tecnificar sus cultivos. Sus sueños es mediante a los ingresos darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de estudio de las que ella tuvo en su juventud dando la oportunidad a sus hijos de enviarlos a la universidad para que sean personas de provecho.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, in a relationship, and has two children. She has been working in agriculture for 15 years, and her speciality is the cultivation of coffee. She learnt this activity together with her partner and her parents, since they have been farmers their whole lives. Rosa has completed primary school thanks to the support of her parents. 

In agriculture, coffee is a particularly delicate product and if it isn't treated in time with the necessary inputs, the whole harvest can be lost. That is why she has requested a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL, which she will use to buy 12 kg of fertilizers, 12 kg of urea, 10 kg of coffee formula, and other things that she will use to keep her cultivation safe and healthy for the next harvest.

Her long-term goal is to expand her cultivation of coffee by buying more land, sow a type of coffee that is more competitive, and use more machinery. Her dream is to use her income to offer her family a better quality of life, better study opportunities than she had herself when she was young, and to send her children to university so that they can become resourceful persons.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and urea for her coffee cultivations

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique e tem 25 anos. É casado e pai de 1 rapariga de apenas 2 anos.
É proprietário de um estaleiro há 2 anos,  com os lucros obtidos conseguiu dar inicio da sua obra (está a construir uma casa para si e para a sua família). Pretende com o valor do empréstimo dar continuidade à sua obra, adquirindo materiais de construção como cimento, areia, varoes e mais . Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku para habitação.
Pretende concluir toda ela porque no momento encontra se a viver num quarto ja acabado na mesma obra.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a two-year-old daughter.
For the past two years he has owned a shipyard, and he has used his earnings there to start building a house for himself and his family. He will use this loan to continue the work on his house, buying construction materials such as cement and sand. This is his first home construction loan from Hluvuku.
He hopes to finish the whole house, because at the moment he is living in a single completed room of the house.

loans.use: to continue the work on his house, buying construction materials such as cement and sand.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
A Senhora Felismina é casada, tem 38 anos de idade, é mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam nível primário  e secundário. É negociante há mais de 5 anos, trabalha 12 horas diárias e vive na casa própria.
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar batata, farinha, frangos, bolachas e sumos para revender. No futuro pretende vender em grandes quantidades ou a grosso. Sempre continuará a fazer empréstimos na Hluvuku-Adsema para poder investir mais.
texts.en:
Felismina is 38 years old and married. She has three children who are all in school. She has had a business for more than five years and works more than 12 hours a day in her shop. She lives in her own home. 
She will use this loan to buy sweet potatoes, flour, chickens, crackers, and juices to sell. In the future she hopes to sell in large quantities and at wholesale. She will continue to request loans from Hluvuku-Adsema so she can invest more in her business.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, flour, chickens, crackers, and juices to sell.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 37 years old, married, and has two children, who attend high school.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been selling used materials to local people since 2005. His wife is dressmaker at a sewing facility. 

His house has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair so he is requesting a loan for 4,500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter, tiene 50 años, está casado y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Walter se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años con ayuda de 2 colaboradores quienes se encargan de apoyarlo en la selección, traslado y venta de los pescados, así puede mantener a su familia tranquila y brindándoles lo que necesita, su constante ánimo de superación ha hecho que incursione en este negocio y poco a poco se ha hecho muy conocido, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado. Eventualmente, él mismo realiza la pesca de las especies de mayor demanda cada 2 semanas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, considera que lo más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que emana de los pescados, ya que este se le impregna en la ropa y el cuerpo, a pesar de ellos espera tener en el futuro un vehículo acondicionado que le permita transportar y conservar sus productos frescos por mucho más tiempo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará una nueva red de pesca con todos los implementos requeridos para cumplir bien su trabajo.
texts.en:
Walter is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He and his family live in their own home. Walter buys and sells fresh fish and has been in this business for three years. He works with the help of two colleagues who are in charge of selecting, transporting, and selling the fish. Walter is able to keep his family steady and provide what they need. His constant drive for success has allowed him to make progress in his business. Over time, he has become well-known since he sells the freshest and the most flavorful fish at the market. On a regular basis, Walter goes fishing every two weeks so that he can catch the types of fish that are in the greatest demand.

What he enjoys most is conversing with his customers. Walter considers the most difficult part of his job to be withstanding the intense odor that emanates from the fish since the smell can permeate his clothes and his body. Despite these challenges, he hopes to have a vehicle in the future so that he can transport and preserve his fresh products much longer.

Walter is taking this opportunity to request 1,000 PEN. He is appreciative of this opportunity and is confident that he will receive the loan. In return, he promises to complete his payments in a punctual manner. The amount he requested will be used to buy a new fishing net with all of the implements that are required to do his job well.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 60 años, está casada con Hugo con quien tiene 7 hijos, aunque actualmente vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida. Prepara a diario los mas ricos desayunos y almuerzos que deleitan el paladar de sus clientes. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de la atención durante las mañanas mientras que ella se dirige al mercado para comprar todo lo necesario para la preparación de sus comidas. Su puesto esta ubicado cerca de su casa, frente a un hospital y a un parque, lo cual se convierte en su mejor aliado para contar siempre con clientes que acuden a su establecimiento en busca de saciar su hambre. Su rutina se termina por la tarde y toma este tiempo para descansar y renovar energía para que al día siguiente muy temprano nuevamente se levante a preparar . Lleva en este rubro más de 21 años y lo complementa además con la venta de golosinas y frutas. Este trabajo le gusta mucho ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pero también sabe que su clientela exige mucho en cuanto a sabor y comodidad, es por eso que desea comprar los principales ingredientes al por mayor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros productos que usa continuamente en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 60, is married to Hugo with whom she has 7 children although she now lives just with her husband and two of her children in a house of her own.  Rosa works selling food.  Daily she prepares the most delicious breakfasts and lunches for her customers’ enjoyment.  She works with help from her husband who takes care of service in the morning while she heads to the market to buy everything needed to prepare the meals.

Her stand is located near home in front of a hospital and a park which has become her best ally to have customers always who come by her establishment seeking to assuage their hunger.  Her routine ends in the afternoon and the takes this time to rest and renew her energy so that the next day she can once again rise and prepare.  

She’s been in this line of work for more than 21 years and she complements it with the sale of snacks and fruit.  She likes the work very much because it generates good profits but also because she knows that her clientele demands flavor and comfort.  This is why she wants to buy the main ingredients at wholesale.

On this occasion she’s going to request 600 soles.  She thanks all those who make her access to this loan possible so that she can continue reaching her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested amount to buy rice, oil, sugar and other products she uses continually in her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, oil, sugar and others.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustín tiene 52 años de edad, es una persona responsable y dedicada a su trabajo y su familia, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos de 14 y 18 años de edad dependen y viven con él ellos estudian actualmente, desde hace 22 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de de su hogar, Don Agustín solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herramientas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Agustín, age 52, is a responsible person, who is devoted to his work and his family.  He lives in his own house with his life partner.  He has four children, but only two of them, ages 14 and 18, are dependent.  They live with him and attend school.

Agustín has been growing corn and beans for 22 years.  With the income that he gets, he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Agustín is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like herbicides, fertilizers, compost, seeds, and tools, etc.  He will do this in order to continue with his crops.  This way he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, compost, seeds, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Zokir

texts.en:
A man who is hardworking and kind needs some financing. He is Zokir. He is 28 years old. He has one child, and he is the main bread winner in the family. He lives in a village, where most local people are busy with animal husbandry and farming. Seven years ago, Zokir began his own business in farming. He grows maize and watermelon. He works every day, from early morning until late evening, on his own land. He knows his business very well and has great experience. Since he has been running his own farm, his parents have been helping him. He sells his harvest at the local market. He has his own customers, because his harvest is of high quality. 

He wants to develop his business further and to get a good profit. With this aim, Zokir is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni. He will use it to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. He has many perfect plans for the future, and he tries to realize them. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Esso-Essina 3 Group

texts.fr: Groupement constitué de femmes toutes des agricultrices(culture du mais et du riz),madame Pyalou est nommée pour diriger ce groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Elles rêvent toutes de devenir une grande productrice de riz et de mais et subvenir aux besoins de la famille c'est pour cela, elle sollicite leur troisième crédit à WAGES pour atteindre leur objectif.
texts.en: This group is made up of women who are all farmers (corn and rice crops). Madam Pyalou was nominated to lead this group. Married, she is mother to 4 children of whom 2 go to school. They all dream of becoming great rice and corn producers and to meet the needs of their families. Because of this, they are requesting their third loan from WAGES to attain their objective.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Fonk Sa Bopp Grandlouga Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de  femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Anta l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 32 ans, veuve et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo et a levé la main gauche. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de diverses marchandises et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 6 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter du pain de singe , 02 sacs de sucre à 23000F l'un ,02 bassines  de fleur d'oseilles séchés à 3000f l'un, du tamarin, 50Kg de gingembre pour la transformation en jus,en crème glace. Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois, gère sa famille, assure la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group consists of women who live in the same neighborhood; their main business is retail. Anta, the featured borrower, is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old, widowed and mother to five children. She is standing to the right in the photo and has raised her left hand. She manages a small retail business selling a variety of merchandise and capitalizes on good experience of more than 6 years. With her loan she plans to buy baobab fruit, 2 bags of sugar at 23,000 F each, 2 basins of dried sorrel flowers at 3,000 F each, tamarind, 50 kg of ginger for transformation into juice and ice cream. With her profits she saves at the level of the "banc villageois", manages her family, and ensures the schooling and the health of her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto de 55 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de sorbetes y paletas de forma  ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Roberto solicita un crédito para la compra de sorbetes y paletas por mayor para seguir con su negocio, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 55, is a very hard-working and responsible person. He lives in his own home with his life partner and his child. For a year he has worked selling sorbets and ice pops as a street vendor. He sells them throughout different neighborhoods and markets near his place of residence. The earnings from his business are able to cover some of his household expenses. 

Roberto is seeking a loan in order to purchase sorbets and ice pops in bulk to continue with his business. By doing this he hopes to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy sorbets and ice pops in bulk.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a fish buyer from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Rosita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more fish in the market including her husband's catch. In the future, Rosita hopes to make her business a success and stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 48, is married and has five children. From a very young age he started working in the field helping his father and  his uncles in their farming. On his own now, he works growing crops on a small farm lot he inherited from his father when he died. 

George is a work-driven man. Doing this would mean a lot to his family. Despite the difficulties that usually  arise, he always seeks options that will allow him to continue forward. This is what motivated him to request a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticide and fungicide to provide for his crop care so he can harvest quality produce to sell easily in the market thus earning income and to continue advancing toward reaching his dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticide and fungicide

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and her children are settled and on their own and have finished their studies. It’s not quite easy to handle a big family, but it’s not tiring to Lourdes as she was determined to see her family’s success. She runs a business where she sells beauty products, jewelries, accessories, ready-to-wear clothing, and different dry goods in town. Lourdes has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC which helped her to expand and improve her business. Her husband earns an income serving the community with a tailoring business. 

Lourdes is requesting a loan to buy more beauty products, assorted slippers, and ready-to-wear clothing to sell. She hopes to build a new shelter for her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, assorted slippers, and ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a lady of thirty years old, married to Simon and a mother of two children. She has rental houses in Kinoo on the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for fifteen years now and gets monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Irene's sixth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy building materials to finish building some of the rental units. In future she plans to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement, sand, etc

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old and married to Joyce who does retail business. He sells kerosene in Nairobi town and it has been profitable. He currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is his third loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more kerosene to sell. He anticipates generating more income which he will use to buy more stock.

James hopes to grow his business and open a fuel station in the area and thereby be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Robin

texts.es:
Robin es un hombre muy trabajador sobre todo porque tiene una familia por quien salir adelante y dar lo mejor de sí y más aún porque su pequeño hijo tiene tan solo 4 años. Robin trabaja desde hace un año en una empresa de su ciudad como auxiliar contable, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable.

Robin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su hogar,  ya que debido a las lluvias los artículos que tenía en su  hogar se han deteriorado, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buen profesión  sus hijos y mejorar calidad de vida de su familia”
texts.en:
Robin’s a very hardworking man above all because he has a family to support and to give his best for even more so because his little boy is only four-years-old.  Robin has worked for a local firm as an accounting aide for a year.  He works about 9 hours daily and believes he’s doing well because he’s responsible.

Robin’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to buy home furnishings because the rain damaged some of the things he had at home.  He will thus be able to improve his quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to provide good professions for his children and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy home furnishings.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and running a restaurant. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Margarita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap, snack foods, and other products for her general store business. In the future, she dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap, snack foods, and other products

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell at her place of business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requests a new loan for her business. Perla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu  is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She sells cooked food from her cafe to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Gabiro Group

texts.fr:
Emelyme  fait partie du groupe  Gabiro  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  27 ans et est mariée  à J. Marie, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 mois à 10 ans dont 1 étudie.
Elle a sous sa charge un orphelin qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de  la bière de banane depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de  bière de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en: Emelyme belongs to the Gabiro group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 27 years old and married to J. Marie, a farmer. They have four children ranging from two months to 10 years of age, one of whom is n school. They also have in their care an orphan, who is also in school. Emelyme has been selling banana beer for over six years. She is on her seventh loan with Turame.  Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a lot of bananas in order to prepare a large volume of banana beer for resale, so as to earn more. In the years to come, she would like to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to bolster her capital and buy a lot of bananas in order to prepare a large volume of banana beer for resale, so as to earn mo

loans.name: Gabriela Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Gabriela es originaria de Managua, tiene 56 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales son independientes. Desde hace 19 años se dedica a la elaboración de forros y tapizados Comenzo su negocio con dinero que su esposo le brindo, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo con el fin de mantener su negocio. Está solicitando el préstamo para comprar productos tales como: Telas para tapizado, cartón, pegamento, esponja entre otros con el fin de incrementar sus ventas a través de su trabajo eficiente. El crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su plan futuro es aumentar su producción para generar mayores ganancias y mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Gabriela is originally from Managua. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are independent. For the past 19 years, she has been making linings and upholstery. Gabriela began her business with money that her husband gave her. Over time she has invested in order to maintain her business.

Gabriela is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as upholstery fabrics, cardboard, glue, sponges, and other items that are needed to increase her sales and perform her work efficiently. The loan will be of great help since she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products. Her plan for the future is to increase her production so that she can generate more income and improve the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy upholstery fabrics, cardboard, glue, sponges, and other items.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is from the Gori district. She is 28 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband and an infant daughter. Her husband works as an artisan locally and earns a monthly salary. Ekaterine is a dentist. She has a dental office in her own house and serves the patients there. She is a skilled dentist and is famous in the area for her professionalism. 

Ekaterine wishes to develop her medical business and obtained the credit from MFO Credo to arrange the waiting area and purchase operative supplies to satisfy the professional needs of the dentist. 

Ekaterine is a very enthusiastic and energetic young woman with a great desire to be successful in her career and look after people’s health.

Ekaterine hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to arrange the waiting area and purchase operative supplies for her dental office

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es: Delmy tiene 34 años de edad y vive en una aldea del municipio de Omoa, en el departamento de Cortes. Vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos, los dos mayores están estudiando. Delmy tiene mas de tres años de tener su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, vanidades y golosinas, ahora ya tiene mejor su negocio mas surtido como una pulpería, ofrece granos básicos, refrescos, jugos, churros, embutidos útiles escolares, vanidades, etc. Actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 18,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, refrescos y otros abarrotes, para mantener surtido. Su plan es crecer con el negocio y superarse cada día más en su negocio y así dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delmy is 34 years old and lives in a village in the municipality of Omoa, in the department of Cortes. She is in a civil union with her partner, with whom she has three children, whereof the two older ones go to school. Delmy has been running her own business for more than three years, selling foodstuffs, knick-knacks, and candy. Nowadays her business is better stocked, like a corner store, and she offers basic grains, soft drinks, juices, chips, sausages, school supplies, knick-knacks, etc.

This is her fourth loan and she will use the 18,000 lempiras to buy basic grains, meats, sausages, soft drinks, and other groceries to have in stock. Her plan is to grow with her business and improve it every day, so that she can offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, sausages, soft drinks, and other groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor posee 37 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta 2º año en la universidad, estudiaba Licenciatura en computación. Actualmente, esta acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a cuidar de sus tres hijos de 12, 11 y 10 años que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.  

Desde hace13 años se dedica al trabajo agrícola, oficio que aprendió gracias a un cuñado. También, conoce de otros trabajos como lo son: albañilería, electricista y fontanería. El lugar donde siembra esta a 5km de su casa, el recorrido lo hace en bicicleta, y las labores las desempeña solo, de 6 a.m. a 5 p.m.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas para usarlos de forma preventiva, si llegara a presentarse un ataque de plagas y sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Debido a que no tiene fondos para realizarlos por su propia cuenta y tener el sustento de la cosecha, para que no le falte la alimentación a su familia.

El sueño de Don Víctor es construir su vivienda, puesto que, en la que vive es de su cuñado. Ademas, poder enseñarles los oficios que conoce a sus hijos, criarlos honesta y responsablemente. El préstamo sera de gran ayuda, porque no les faltara maíz, en lo que resta de este año y en los primeros meses del próximo.
texts.en:
Víctor’s 37-years-old and completed two years of university.  He was studying for a Bachelor’s in Computer Programing.  He currently has a spouse and she cares for their three children who are 12, 11 and 10 years of age and attending school.

He’s been working in agriculture for the last 13 years, an occupation he learned thanks to his brother-in-law.  He also knows how to do other kinds of work like: construction, electrician and plumbing.  His farmland is located 5 kilometers from home and he makes the trip by bicycle.  He works alone from 6am to 5pm.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and fungicide for preventive care in case any pests might attack and to plant 7,000 square meters of corn because he has no funds to do so on his own and to be able to support the crop and so that his family will not lack food.

Víctor’s dream is to build his house because the one he lives in is his brother-in-law’s.  He’d also like to be able to teach the skills he knows to his children and to raise them honestly and responsibly.  The loan will be of great help because they’ll not lack corn for the rest of this year and the first months of next year.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Suwirka

texts.en:
Suwirka just began working with Ruma on July 25, 2013 to run Ruma’s new business cashing in and cashing out customer’s money for Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent in Ruma, Suwirka needs a Kiva loan for working capital to start his new business. Suwirka wishes this new business to be another source of his family's income.

Suwirka lives in Pesagi, Penebel, Bali, a rural area about four hours from Denpasar. Suwirka is married and has two children. He lives with four people in the family house.

Prior to joining Ruma, Suwirka worked as a civil employee and farmer.

loans.use: to process branchless banking products

loans.name: Sarey's Group

texts.en:
Sarey is 49 years old and has five children.  She is a resident of Battambang province. To struggles for the daily cost of living, she farms rice on hectares area and sells grocery items to supplement her income. 

Sarey's group, which consists of five members, is requesting its first loan from VisionFund. All the members including Sarey are requesting a loan for 200,000 KHR each. Sarey will use her loan to buy herbicide for her rice farm. She believes that she can boost her yield by removing weeds so she can save some money for her future needs.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide for her rice farm

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is 29 years old and she is married. She has three children and she has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, milk, fish, books, pencils, slippers, body lotion, and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt,  coffee, milk, fish, books, pencils, and slippers

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María de Jesús es una humilde mujer con 31 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos que día con día se levanta a sus quehaceres diarios en el hogar y luego en compañía de su compañero de hogar a sus actividades en el campo. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el 4 grado ya que por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres no pudo continuar ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos económicos. Ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus padres ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a muy temprana edad las diferentes actividades y proceso para cultivar. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja trabajan está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ella habita por lo tanto se le hace más fácil estar pendiente de los mismos y poder darle una mejor y mayor asistencia.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar 8 unidades de nutricafe, 4 unidades de formula cafetalera y 2 kilos de abono foliar. Esto protegerá y dará un mayor follaje y atractiva a sus cultivos de café para sus clientes.

Sus sueños son los de darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida ampliar sus cultivos sembrando una mayor y mejor variedad ya que de esa forma ella fortalecerá y atraerá mas clientes para percibir mayores ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is a humble, 31-year-old woman who is a housewife and farmer; she’s mother of two children.  She rises daily to do her chores at home and then in the company of her housemate heads out to do the work in the fields.  

She did not complete elementary school; she only got up to fourth grade because her parents couldn’t provide any more economic support because they were of very scarce economic resources.  She learned to work the land thanks to her parents since they taught her the various activities and agricultural processes at a young age.  The land she and her spouse work is located on the same property where she lives which makes it easier for her to tend to it and to be able to provide better and greater maintenance.

She has asked Comixmul Cooperative for a loan she plans to use to buy 8 units of coffee food, 4 units of coffee formula fertilizer and 2 kilos of leaf fertilizer.  This will protect and produce richer, more attractive foliage to her coffee crop for her customers.

Her dream is to provide her children with better quality of life and to expand her planted land planting more and greater variety since this is the way to strengthen it and to attract more customers in order to earn higher income and support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre  soltera, tiene una hija, vive en el municipio de San Antonio de Cortes con su hija, nieto y yerno. Hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de licuados de frutas como ser de fresa, banano, sandia, melón etc., y la venta de golosinas como baleadas, tacos, churros, dulces y otros. Ha mantenido estable el negocio mediante varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el numero ocho el cual es por  6,000 Lempiras este lo va invertir en la compra de frutas, azúcar y leche para hacer los licuados, churros, refrescos, dulces y otros insumos, para tener variedad y poder  incrementar la clientela y las ventas.  Su meta es mejorar su casa y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and a single mother of one daughter. She lives in the municipality of San Antonio de Cortes with her daughter, grandson, and son-in-law. 

For 13 years, she has earned a living by selling fruit smoothies made of strawberry, banana, watermelon, melon, etc., and snacks such as stuffed tortillas, tacos, churros (fritters), sweets, and other things. The business has been stable due to various loans, and she is currently requesting her eighth loan (for 6000 Lempiras) which she will use to purchase fruit, sugar, and milk in order to make smoothies, churros, drinks, sweets, and other items. This will allow her to offer more variety and increase the number of customers and sales. 

Francisca's goal is to make improvements to her home and to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, and milk to make smoothies, churros (fritters), drinks, sweets, and other edible items.

loans.name: Melsbek

texts.en: Melsbek, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. His family has recently purchased an old apartment. His elder daughter studies at high school while the younger one goes to kindergarten. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2001 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers and driving them quickly to their destination. His wife has been working as a crane machinist for twelve years at a copper enrichment facility. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase hardwood floors, vacuum insulated windows, wallpaper, paint, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his old apartment. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 25-year-old married man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his wife and small son in a simple house in the city. Naser works as an employee in the public sector, and gets a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

When Naser got married few years ago, he could not buy all the furniture for his new home because of the high wedding expenses.  Now, he would like to buy all the missing stuff for his home. 

Naser took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy furniture for the living room. Using this loan, Naser will be able to improve the living conditions in his home. 

Naser appears in the photo while he was in the furniture store.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the living room

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Hala is a 25-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Al Noserat in Gaza strip. Hala works as an employee and gets a very low wage. Hala's brother is preparing his new home to be ready to live in it as he will get married soon. Hala would like to help her brother get part of the furniture for his home.

Hala took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy bedroom furniture for her brother's new home.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture for her brother's new home.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un homme marié de 27 ans et père de 1 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez sa tante dans le quartier Massabla coura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fait l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus telles la réparation des motos, mais fini par opter pour l’achat vente des pièces détachées. 
Nanti de 3 années d’expériences, il est très sollicité et apprécié à Bougouni et afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il rejoint Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 10 pneus de moto “Djakarta” 15 pneus pour bicyclette, 10 batteries pour moto “Djakarta” 2 trousseaux de clé, 10 chambres – à air et 10 pistons à Bamako. Il est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les 2 prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé. Avec ce prêt, Yaya compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir son entreprise, payer les intérêts et à construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Yaya is a married man, 27 years old and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and child at his aunt's home in the Massable Coura neighborhood of Bougouni. 

Without having received formal education, Yaya began working at an early age at income-generating activities, such as motorcycle repair, before finally settling on purchase and resale of spare parts. Now with 3 years of experience, he is much sought after and appreciated in Bougouni.

In order to meet his customers' needs and grow his business, Yaya is again joining with Soro Yiriwaso to purchase 10 "Djakarta" motorcycle tires, 15 bicycle tires, 10 "Djakarta" motorcycle batteries, two key rings, 10 air tubes and 10 pistons in Bamako. He is on his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and both previous loans were fully repaid. With this loan, Yaya hopes to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA. He plans to use this profit to grow his business, pay the loan interest, and build a home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 42 años, es divorciada y vive con su hijo en su casa propia.
El trabajo de Maritza consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, muchas veces espera que el cliente llegue a su local y le pida un diseño exclusivo o únicamente solicite la refacción de alguna prenda, en ocasiones ella misma se inspira en nuevos diseños y crea sus propia prendas en el que destaca su estilo personal, además de confeccionar prendas de vestir, también se dedica a confeccionar sabanas y cortinas para venderlas entre sus clientes, familiares y amigos. Su taller esta ubicado en su casa en donde acondicionó un lugar para trabajar tranquila. Lleva realizando este negocio por 11 años y con el tiempo aprendió a darle un buen acabado a su trabajo. Le gusta lo que hace pues es independiente, tiene su propio horario de trabajo y además le brinda a otras personas la oportunidad de trabajar ya que en ciertas temporadas contrata personal por que tiene demasiados pedidos y no se abastece ella sola. Desea continuar realizando su trabajo y más adelante tener un taller más grande con más máquinas y más trabajadores. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.300, por ello agradece a las personas que hacen posible su crédito y le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para lograr sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales como hilos, agujas, botones y telas para continuar confeccionando las prendas de vestir y las sábanas que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old, is divorced and lives with her son in a house they own. Maritza's work consists of cutting and making clothing. Often she waits for the customer to come to her place and ask for an exclusive design or just ask for some article of clothing to be repaired. Sometimes she herself is inspired by new designs and creates her own clothing, in which she highlights her personal style. In addition to making clothing, she also makes a living from making sheets and curtains to sell among her customers, family and friends.

Her workshop is located in her home, where she has prepared a space to work calmly. She has had this business for eleven years and as time passed she learned how to give a good finish to her work. She likes what she does at it is independent, she has her own work schedule and also provides other people with the opportunity to work, as she hires staff during certain seasons because she has too many requests and she cannot supply everything herself. She wants to continue doing her work and to have a bigger workshop with more machines and more workers in the future.

At this time she is requesting 300 Peruvian nuevos soles. She thanks the people who have made her loan possible and who give her the opportunity to continue working to achieve her objectives. With the requested amount she will buy material like thread, needles, buttons and fabrics to continue making the clothing and the sheets that she sells.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, buttons and fabrics

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.pt:
Eugenia nasceu na Provincial de Inhambane sul de Moçambique , tem 51 anos fez o Ensino Primário  é solteira mãe de 4 filhos todos vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pelos seus 3 netos que vivem  com ela na mesma casa.
 E proprietário de uma banca a mais de 10 anos  no Mercado Central da Namaacha onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o valor emprestado pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos tais como, farinha de milho, açucar, batata, oleo, tomate e mais.vende também no Mercado Informal Shoprite nas quartas e sabados uma feira onde ha intercâmbio da venda de varios produtos com outros países . Este é seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku para o comércio. 
Futuramente pretende adquirir mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial na sua residência.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 51 years old and was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She completed primary school. She is unmarried and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also supports three grandchildren who live with her in her home.
For more than 10 years she has had a stall in the central market in Namaacha where she sells staple goods. She will use this loan to increase the amount of products such as corn meal, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, and tomatoes that she carries. On Fridays and Saturdays, she also sells at the Shoprite informal market, which offers a range of products from other countries. This is her second business loan from Hluvuku.
In the future she’d like to request more loans to build a shop in her home.

loans.use: to increase the amount of products such as corn meal, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, and tomatoes that she carries.

loans.name: Antonio Alberto

texts.es: Don Antonio tiene 57 años de edad, es un hombre muy  trabajador  y responsable con sus  obligaciones del hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia que está conformada por su esposa y sus 5 hijos aunque solo los tres menores ahora dependen de él, hace 21 años  que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Antonio solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old. He is a very hard-working man and is responsible with his household obligations. He lives in a house he owns with his family, which consists of his wife and their five children, although only the three youngest children depend on him at the moment. He has made a living by cultivating corn and beans for the last 21 years, selling his products at agencies for the buying and selling of basic grains that are near his place of residence. With the earnings he obtains from he sales, he is able to cover some household expenses.

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc. to be able to obtain better earnings and give his family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Ten

texts.en:
Ten is 26 years old and a single woman. She has a low education due to financial constraints in her family. She decided to become involved in the farming business to earn a livelihood in Kompong Cham province. She plants rice and mung beans and sells them to local traders after harvest season. She is very hardworking and aims to move ahead in her business. She has been engaged in farming for over five years. Thanks to her business, today she is able to earn a net income of KHR 40,000 per day.

In order to help her maintain her crops, she has requested a loan in the amount of KHR 2,500,000 to buy farm supplies and pay laborers for land preparation. She wants to use the earnings from the loan to reinvest into her business and achieve a stable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay laborers for land preparation.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 40 years old married to Rose and they have three children who are in school.

He is in the transport business in Naivasha town where he has operated for the past six years. He also has a shop which is run by his wife. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to repair his motorbike and buy flour and sugar, among others, for his shop. He plans to buy a motorbike with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Jackson hopes to buy a Nissan so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and buy stock for the shop such as flour and sugar among others.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera  vive en casa propia  junto a su hijo de 17 años quien actualmente estudia, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 17 años es una persona muy responsable, honesta y amble con sus clientes estas razones la han llevado han ser una costurera con mucho prestigio y demanda en la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos en el hogar. Cándida solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como telas, zippers, botones, agujas, hilos, etc. Para continuar con su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
39-year old Cándida is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 17-year old son who is currently studying. Cándida has been making clothing for 17 years. She is a responsible and honest person who is friendly to her clients and as a result she has a good reputation and is in demand in her neighbourhood. She is able to cover a lot of her household expenses with the profits she makes from her work.

Cándida is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, zips, buttons, needles, thread etc. so she can continue with her business, make better profits and improve her own and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zips, buttons, needles, thread etc.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a 43-year-old widowed mother of four in Thika. She earns a living for her family by operating a quarry. She earns a monthly income of KES 23,200, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. Annastacia is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to purchase mining tools and employ additional casual workers. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. 

In the future, Annastacia plans to continue to invest in her business and purchase a piece of land to construct a permanent residential house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mining tools and employ additional casual workers.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 35, is married and has a son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker at a garment factory.

Thanh has been running a business of selling construction components and equipment in front of his house for 15 years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying different construction materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his child to school.

loans.use: To buy construction components and equipment.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married 57-year-old mother of two and lives in Poblacion Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband worked as a laborer and at the same time farms their own farm to make a living. She plants and harvests rice for family consumption and sells a portion for their daily needs.  

She joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to micro-finance services. Recently, Luzviminda borrowed 30,000 PHP  to purchase lumber in order to repair their house. A portion of this loan will also be used for the placement fee of her child who plans to work abroad. 

She is thankful to GDMPC that gives them access to micro-finance services and helps to fulfill their plans to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase lumber in order to repair their house and for the placement fee of her child.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a 51-year-old married father of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a retail shop which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This is his first loan term with KADET after he was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

With the loan that he has applied for from KADET Ltd., James will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Additional income created will allow him to improve his retail shop by purchasing more stock. In the future, James would like to expand the current businesses so that his children can take over as he ages. 

He hopes to construct a permanent residential house and have a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, age 40, runs a boutique shop where she sells clothing items to earn a living. She has operated her business for the past 20 years. She lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda with her husband and their two children, both of whom are currently attending school. 
 
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell in her shop. This will help Stella to generate greater profits and pay some of her children's school fees. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger shop. 
 
Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Djénéba est une célibataire de 25 ans et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant chez ses parents dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Mademoiselle Djénéba est diplômé en Secrétariat de Direction. Après avoir eu son diplôme, elle est resté longtemps sans avoir un emploi. Ainsi pour subvenir à ses besoins elle décide de mener des activités génératrices notamment l’achat et la vente des habits, chaussures et parfums. Elle appris cette activité auprès de son amie et de ma mère. Avec 5 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité. Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant elle, décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes, 10 cartons de parfums et 10 paires de chaussures de différentes qualités. Elle est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et . tous les  deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali )et parfois au Burkina. La vente se fait à la maison et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni. La plus-part de ses clients sont les femmes. Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Avec ses bénéfices elle envisage améliorer son activité, aider ses parents dans les dépenses de la famille, et à payer les intérêts.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle Djénéba is single, 25 years old and mother to 1 child. She lives with her child at the home of her parents in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

Mademoiselle Djénéba has a diploma in secretarial management. After having received her diploma, she went a long time without having a job. Thus in order to meet her needs she decided to manage businesses that would generate income, notably buying and selling clothing, shoes and perfumes. She learned this business from her friend and her mother. With 5 years experience, she has mastered her business. To obtain a consistent working capital she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 pieces of pagnes [African fabric], 10 cartons of perfumes and 10 pairs of shoes of different qualities. She is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and both preceding loans were correctly repaid.

She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali) and sometimes in Burkina. She sells from home and in the different neighborhoods of Bougouni. Most of her clients are women. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. With her profits she envisions improving her business, helping her parents with the family expenses, and paying the interest.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items.

loans.name: Fassery Coulibaly

texts.fr:
Natif de Bougouni, Monsieur Fassery est un homme marié de 41 et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec ses femmes et ses enfants chez son feu père à Bougouni dans le quartier Niebala.
Monsieur Fassery a vite abandonné l’école pour devenir un apprenti chauffeur. Dix années plus tard il obtient son permis de conduire. Ce qui fait qu’il transporte les commerçants pour les différents marchés hebdomadaires. C’est comme ça qu’il c’est  lui aussi s’intéressé aux activités génératrice de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès des commerçants. 
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Après une longue réflexion, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de petit mil.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants mais aussi dans le Wassoulou pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de Bougouni et  une partie à Yanfolila ses clients son surtout les commerçants. Il est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les 2 prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA. C’est avec ses bénéfices qu’il envisage subvenir à ses dépenses, payer les intérêts du prêt et a agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
A native of Bougouni, Mister Fassery is a 41 year old married man and father to 3 children. He lives with his wives and his children at the home of his father-in-law in Bougouni in the Niebala neighborhood.

Mister Fassery soon left school to become a driver's apprentice. Ten years later he got his driver's license. He drives shopkeepers to the different weekly markets. In this way he also became interested in income generating businesses notably buying and selling cereals. He learned this business from the shopkeepers.

With more than 5 years experience, he is skilled in his business.

After much reflection, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 bags of corn and 10 bags of millet.

He gets his supplies in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages but also in Wassoulou to then resell at the Bougouni market and in Yanfolila. His clients are mostly shopkeepers. He is on his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Both preceding loans were correctly repaid.

With this loan he envisions making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA. It's with these profits that he envisions meeting his expenses, paying the interest of the loan and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 27 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Karina consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería como talcos, desodorantes, perfumes, colonias, lápiz labial, cremas de ojos entre otros. Trabaja en su casa en donde tiene instalado una pequeña vitrina de exhibición que le permite mostrar mejor su mercadería. Sus clientes se encuentran distribuidos por diversas calles de la ciudad, sus principales clientes son sus amigos y conocidos, trabaja bajo el sistema de venta crediticia, cumple esta función desde hace 4 años. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite poder estar en constante actividad durante el día generar ingresos para su hogar tranquilamente, además que le da tiempo por las noches de descansar y recargar energías para el día siguiente, espera continuar trabajando y progresar y más adelante establecer una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su propia casa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado, comprará talcos, cremas corporales, cremas de manos y algunos perfumes para que continúe realizando sus ventas.
texts.en: Karina is 27 years old and is a single mother of two children who live with her in their own home.
